boardgame.name: The Game of Heck
boardgame.description:
This is a card game from Stoll & Edwards. Essentially a set collection game, "Heck" is played with 12 numbered cards dealt out to players at the start. Three special Heck cards are placed face-up in the center of the table. The object is to get a continuous sequence of cards in your hand: six if there are two players; four if there are three players; and three if there are four players.

Players throw three dice, each with 1-4, a star, and a crescent moon on its faces. Whatever number is rolled, they may "call" for that card, and if another player has it, they must give it. Throwing three stars allows a player to call for any card they want to help make a continuous sequence. Throwing three crescents allows them to draw a Heck card and use it as a wild card in a sequence.

The first player to complete a sequence wins the game, "by Heck!"

boardgame.name: Blood of a King
boardgame.description:
In Blood of a King the object of the game is to wound your opponent's King 3 times. Each player starts with a deck of 12 cards, 10 Warrior cards numbered 0-9, 1 King card numbered 10, and 1 Witch card numbered 11. A round begins by each player dealing out five card onto the play surface from left to right. The cards have a silhouette of an Axe or a Shield along the long edge of the card. When the edges of the cards line up they will either match axes, shields, or have no match. The number of Axes is your attack strength, the number of shields your defense. If you have more Axes than you opponent has Shields, you have wounded their tribe. See what their highest numbered card is. If it is a Warrior, remove the card from play. If it is the King, give them one of your matching wound cards. If it is their Witch, remove their Witch from play, but also remove your lowest Warrior card.

If the initial draw of cards results in a tie, each player plays another card to the right of the last card played. Count Axes and Shields again, and follow the above results.

If your tribe is going to be wounded by your opponent you may CALL UPON THE BERSERKS! When you Call Upon The Berserks you may draw one card and play it to either end of your row of cards. You may do this only once per round and the Berserk card will be removed from play after the round.

Continue playing rounds until one player has received the three wound cards from their opponent.

—from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bow-o-Wink
boardgame.description: This is a tiddledy winks game in which the aim is to snap the counters into the open mouth of one of three dog characters with oversized heads.

boardgame.name: Kamigami Battles: HP Lovecraft promo
boardgame.description:
Promo handed at at origins 2021.

ACT Reduce the cost of moon artifacts by 1 diamond this turn
ACT Draw 1 Card
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Kamigami Battles: Battle of the Nine Realms

boardgame.name: Nothing to Talk About
boardgame.description:
Nothing To Talk About is a zine with 9 games for 2 people to play over any messaging app. All of the games are vastly unique, with a range of styles and mechanics. Use these as an ice breaker, a stress reliever, a creative brainstorming tool, or a way to explore a relationship!

Each game encourages play through a ritualized setting. One simply needs to send a photo of a single page of rules to someone on the other end of their phone, and the game begins!

2 players
Ages 14+
5-10 minute play time

boardgame.name: Pirate's Shipwreck Slums
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined ship graveyard has been turned into a scummy seaside town, built into the shallows of a deadly reef. Timber walkways and docks connect broken ships, which have been turned into living quarters and taverns. The whole place is notorious for the criminals it harbours, and the generally dangerous demeanour of its poor inhabitants.

With this map and its system-agnostic one-shot adventure featuring an absurd encounter with a fat man with magical tattoos on his back, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a confusing but fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Shipwreck Ruins of Jacob's Town
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined ship graveyard was once turned into a seaside town. Timber walkways and docks connect broken ships, which were living quarters and taverns. But no longer. Now this town is merely ruins, filled with restless undead and a handful who dare scavange here.

With this map and its system-agnostic one-shot adventure featuring a noble’s scandal which cost many lives, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: The Sunken Maw
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined ship graveyard rests on the bottom of the ocean, overgrown with coral and other strange underwater plants.

With this map and its system-agnostic one-shot adventure featuring undead pirates seeking treasure which will grant them immortality, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Skyship Slums of Aeraveska
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Skyships have been roped together with timber walkways and nets to form these flying slums. Hot air balloons help keep the area aloft, though it still relies on the arcane generator–alongside the rest of the flying city (grab our free Adventurer’s Guide to Aeraveska for more worldbuilding!).

With this map and its system-agnostic one-shot adventure featuring a plot to blow up the arcane generator and send the flying city hurtling towards the ground, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Skyship Ruins of Aeraveska
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Skyships have been roped together with timber walkways and nets to form a flying fortress, though it is now ruined and seemingly abandoned. Hot air balloons help keep the area aloft, though the fortress is falling apart in many places. Holes have been blasted in the sides of the ships and along the boardwalks. The whole area is maintained by steampunk golems, who outlived their masters, but have now run out of materials.

With this map and its system-agnostic one-shot adventure featuring a young-adult half-elf searching for the mercenary father who abandoned him, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Sunken Coastal Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This half-sunken underwater temple waits along a verdant coast, covered with palms and lush greenery. The temple itself has two stories; one above the water, and one below it. The underwater portion is filled with strange artifacts, and has two tunnels leaving out at the end.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure which explores whether or not traditions can have value even if the reasoning behind them has been forgotten, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Sunken Temple of the Black Depths
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This sunken underwater temple lies deep in the dark depths, on a sea shelf overgrown with strange blue coral. The temple itself has two stories, and at its heart is a room with broken chains. Was some great evil imprisoned there?

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure where a desperate father releases a terrible and evil spirit, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Flying Mechanist's Airship
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This flying fortress soars through clouds, with six giant fans along its sides to help keep it aloft alongside magic. Inside it are piles of papers for research stacked up on rows of desks, living quarters, and steampunk pipes to help control the building. The upper levels have a tower where the Master lives, with research offices and a small library.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure featuring a man who accidentally turned himself into a golem who desperately needs the help of a hermit wizard named Cadmus the Cranky, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Mechanist's Guilde of Aeraveska
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the heart of a bustling city in the sky waits this Mechanist’s Guild. The skilled mechanists inside it are responsible for keeping the flying city of Aeraveska afloat, in spite of its old and rusting state.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure featuring political extremist Magnus Sharpe’s cronies taking the Grand Artificer captive and threatening to kill him, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Builders Pack 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A new selection of stony wall types.

boardgame.name: Builders Pack 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New selection of metal wall types with some additional barky wood and 2 stone fences

Each wall type is available as various tiles as usual and multiple color variants!

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 29
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Additional batch of Creatures

This pack contains 6 new Creature Tokens: Giant Coral Snake, Guardian Naga, Spirit Naga, Swarm of Poisonous Snakes, Triceratops and Young Silver Dragon ! each with multiple color variants!

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 30
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Additional batch of Creatures

This pack contains 6 new Creature Tokens each with multiple color variants:

Behir - Huge
Giant Spider - Large (Update)
Eye Freak - Medium
Evil Eye - Medium
Deva - Medium
Young Green Dragon - Large

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 31
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Additional batch of Creatures

This pack contains 6 new Creature Tokens each with multiple color variants:

Storm Giant - Huge
Archmage - Medium
Pit Fiend - Large
Earth Elemental - Large
Fire Elemental - Large

boardgame.name: Magic & Effects 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Magic / spell / environmental effects – Lightning!

boardgame.name: Magic & Effects 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Burn them... burn them all!

Magic / spell / environmental effects – Fire!

boardgame.name: Epic Creatures: Roc vs Cloud Ray
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Next creatures in our series of Epic/Gargantuan/Gigantic monsters that we’ve decided to tackle is a custom one – Roc and Cloud Ray!

boardgame.name: Conflict (Plot) Generator 2 1e
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This tool is either meant to work in addition to Plot Generator, included in Story Mechanisms, included in Essential SoRoPlay GamTools, and included in Basic Solo Fantasy RPG Gaming & Writing Tools. An optional roll decides which of the two to use. Or it may be used alone using the included seed generator.

This chart is meant to give action or situation keywords, that when put together with other keywords help to generate a story. The keywords are meant to help trigger thoughtful and inspirational ideas.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Environmental Sound Encounter Expanded
boardgame.description:
What do you hear in a certain temperature terrain that indicates an animal is nearby? This series of tables first looks at animal sounds as a way to organize animal encounter tables by terrain.

We don't always see first the animals that we encounter in nature. Often, we hear something first—in the thick bushes, moving through tall grass, or among dense woodlands.

So, this issue is entirely focused on expanding and transforming portions of the Sound Generator tool into 25 temperature zone and terrain tables illustrated with mostly gray terrain images.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Pro Wrestling Ref
boardgame.description: From agile high-flying wrestlers to powerful “monster” giant wrestlers to all-around great wrestlers, pro wrestling makes it ways into local venues, indie bingo halls, giant arenas, and even stadiums all across the world.

boardgame.name: Jun 10, 2022
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Coalescence of Mana Flow

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Jun 03, 2022
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Exiled War Council Headquarters

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Sushi Rush
boardgame.description:
It's time for another Sushi Rush tournament!

Prepare your chopsticks and your determination to overcome your opponents in this game of dexterity, skill and delicious sushi. In each round, players will compete simultaneously in different game modes. Master the art of focus and efficiency to become the next Master Sushiman!

On each round, players will draw a card and compete to grab the right combination of sushi with their chopsticks. Each card feature a unique challenge, be it collecting sushis of the same flavor, shape or even stacking them to build the highest tower.

Players receive honor points depending on their success and the one with the most points at the end of the game becomes the next Master Sushiman.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Eye Keeper
boardgame.description:
Play-by-Mail




This game was played solely as a Play-by-Mail (PBM) game, where participants took turns by postal mail and, later, received their turn results. Some PBM games had no published components; others offered a published player's manual or introductory setting guide, etc. Salient details may be noted here in the description - especially for games with no published component.




User summary:

The Eye Keeper was a single-character, hand moderated game. Actions took place on one of the four islands of Enhir, said to be created by Tyr Azeroth.

The Eye Keeper received a favorable review in Gamesman (Issue 4).

boardgame.name: Bunker Golf
boardgame.description:
This is a miniature golf game from E. E. Fairchild. The board has a "tee-off" space in the center with nine areas - the nine golf holes - radiating out from it. The goal is to play all nine holes in the lowest number of strokes.

The game comes with a miniature metal club (approx. 4 inches long) and two metal balls.

boardgame.name: The Novel Game of Stop and Go!
boardgame.description:
The baby is hungry! The first player to get to the Milk Man and then back home with a bottle of milk will win.

Fundamentally this is a movement game, using two traffic cop spinners that tell players how many spaces to move, what direction they can go, and whether or not they can turn. According to the All-Fair catalog, the game "teaches traffic rules with great gusto and lots of fun."

Players use little metal cars as tokens and are allowed to share spaces. Both the Milk Man and the Policeman (the entrance to Home) must be reached on exact spins.

The game was published with a double-sided board that has a checkerboard on the other side.

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Revolution!
boardgame.description:
Behold the city of Korvosa, the gateway to fabled Varisia. Those with the most guile, cunning, and simple brute force control the city. Welcome to Pathfinder Revolution!

Secretly bid against your opponents for control of important people and guilds, gaining influence in different regions throughout the city, as well as more gold, power, or blackmail for your war chest. Gold can sway the Guildmaster, and blackmail may turn the Hellknight to your side, but sometimes the only answer to a problem is force. Can you use the tools of gutter statecraft, bluff or outguess your opponents, and build a coalition to control the city?
Pathfinder Revolution! is a game of bidding and intrigue for three to six players.

Make Your Bid For Power!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rol Gratis (Volumen 1 - Año 2015)
boardgame.description:
Introducción:

Este suplemento que tienes entre tus manos pretende ser un tributo, un homenaje al primer juego de rol español que cumple ya sus 25 años. Con motivo de este cumpleaños y de las iniciativas de regalar rol, desde Nosolorol Ediciones hemos querido hacer este suplemento de ocho aventuras completas ambientadas en el mundo de Aquelarre.

Autores y colaboradores de la editorial se han unido para rendir homenaje a Aquelarre, haciendo partidas de los juegos que conocen profundamente y ambientando esos universos en la época medieval-letal que es el mundo de Aquelarre. Pequeños Detectives de Monstruos, La Torre de Rudesindus, Dreamraiders, Plenilunio, Fragmentos, Cultos Innombrables, Hitos: Guía genérica y el propio Aquelarre, son los juegos que se trasladan a la España medieval de mano de sus autores o de aquellos que conocen profundamente el juego.
Además, desde los más pequeños hasta los jugadores más adultos pueden disfrutar de las páginas de este suplemento. Pensado para que todos puedan disfrutar de sus aventuras y conozcan este gran juego que es Aquelarre, el suplemento quiere involucrar a todo tipo de jugadores con juegos más infantiles, juveniles y adultos. Para facilitarlo, las aventuras están ordenadas en el suplemento desde los jugadores más jóvenes hasta los veteranos.
Pasen y disfruten de estas ocho demoníacas aventuras, un tributo sin igual al alcance de todos.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Una noche en el hotel Álvarez-Honesto

boardgame.name: Rol Gratis (Volumen 2 - Año 2016)
boardgame.description:
Introducción:

Este pequeño libro que tienes entre tus manos es un homenaje, un agradecimiento y un gran abrazo, todo en uno. Festeja dos cumpleaños y lo hace regalando rol, porque este es el primer año en que nuestro pequeño barbudo se encuentra bajo el amparo de una gran familia, familia que además cumple 10 años creando y publicando rol. Celebramos el décimo aniversario de esta casa y el primero de la línea barbuda, y lo hacemos con rol, que es lo que nos gusta.
Nuestro entregado equipo se ha unido a colaboradores externos para celebrar este evento con partidas y escenarios relacionados con los juegos barbudos, prestando especial interés en demostrar sus diferentes particularidades. A su vez, tratamos de descubrirte joyas escondidas con perspectivas diferentes y formas distintas de ver los juegos de rol. A esto, además, sumamos algunos de los pequeños juegos que en su momento fueron traducidos por el equipo barbudo.
Pero dejemos que hable el contenido. Te presentamos material para Fate, Spirit of the Century, Dungeon World y No te duermas. Pequeños destellos con interesantes enfoques.
Esperamos que lo disfrutéis tanto como nosotros.

boardgame.name: Rol Gratis (Volumen 3 - Año 2017)
boardgame.description:
Introducción:

Vámonos de mazmorras

Y ya van tres. Tres años celebrando el Día del Rol Gratis con esta publicación en la que volcamos, como mínimo, el mismo cariño que en cualquiera de nuestros libros. Decimos «como mínimo» porque los volúmenes de Rol Gratis incluyen algo especial: el sincero agradecimiento por tu interés y fidelidad hacia los juegos que publicamos. Sin ti, solo serían páginas impresas. Tú y los tuyos invocáis la verdadera magia de los juegos de rol, transformando palabras e ideas en aventuras, ya sea sobre la mesa o a través de la pantalla (si sois asiduos a las sesiones on-line).
En este volumen queremos explorar la esencia histórica de los juegos de rol, volver a los orígenes, darnos el capricho de perdernos por la compleja sencillez de mazmorras y laberintos. Queremos llevarte de nuevo a templos olvidados, tumbas malditas y salones silentes en un tour de los que siempre cautivan. Es un poco como volver a casa. Y lo hacemos a lomos de juegos que son un canon en esto del mazmorreo (Labyrinth Lord, Dungeon World y Hora de Aventuras), pero también de otros con los que hemos querido sorprenderte (Plenilunio, Fate Acelerado y Cultos Innombrables). Un menú de aventuras a la vieja usanza, tan variado como entretenido.
Así pues, desempolva tus bártulos de explorador y coloca el mapa en el centro de la mesa: acaban de abrirse las puertas del dungeon.
El equipo de Nosolorol Ediciones
boardgame.rpg: Hora de Aventuras Juego de Rol
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Los silenciosos salones de Silas el Silente

boardgame.name: Rol Gratis (Volumen 4 - Año 2018)
boardgame.description:
Introducción:

Alguien tiene que salvar el mundo.

Vuelve el Día del Rol Gratis y volvemos a expresarte nuestro agradecimiento sincero en forma de pequeño regalo, pues hemos crecido como editorial y profesionales gracias a ti. Y lo hacemos de la forma que mejor sabemos: rol, rol y más rol que puedas llevar a tu mesa planteando nuevos retos y perspectivas. Porque no hay una sola forma de disfrutar el rol, sino tantas como autores, grupos y roleros puedas encontrar.
Has salvado al mundo de dioses primigenios, megalómanos, entidades extradimensionales, conspiraciones mundanas y demonios oscuros en diferentes eras y universos. Ahora te toca enfundarte en mallas, colgarte la capa, ponerte el antifaz y salir ahí afuera a enfrentarte con lo que nadie puede. Sabemos que te gustan los superhéroes, esos tipos con habilidades especiales capaces de actuar por un bien mayor sin preocuparse por su propio bienestar; personas destacadas que conocen la responsabilidad que conllevan sus habilidades especiales; hombres y mujeres que no solo arreglan las cosas a golpes, sino que también deben tomar decisiones difíciles en situaciones límite.
El género de superhéroes nos ha traído historias memorables. Queda aquí nuestro pequeño homenaje a los enmascarados (y no enmascarados) que se juegan el tipo de forma altruista movidos por sus convicciones. Cuatro autores, cuatro aventuras, cuatro puntos de vista que podrás jugar con 7º Mar, Fate, No te Duermas y La Mirada del Centinela.
Esperamos que disfrutes las propuestas que te ofrecemos. Métete en la cabina y quítate la camisa. Es hora de salvar el mundo.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Alguien tiene que salvar el mundo
The Time of the Watchers #89 y #90

boardgame.name: Cazamanzanas
boardgame.description:
During the autumnal equinox, the elves compete to be the ones who bring the most apples to the village. They form teams in pairs and go into the forest to collect the apples.

They use ramps, platforms, traps and even magical portals and at nightfall they light a huge bonfire to carry out the apple ritual. The couple of elves that has collected the most apples will be the couple of the year!

Each player will try to make a way with cards (ramps, platforms, duplicators and magic portal) and the apples will fall in their baskets.

Play a card, draw a card... it´s simple!! Each card has a "maduration cost"... and when this track finish all the apples will fall. The players with more apples will win.

boardgame.name: Kakapo
boardgame.description:
Kakapo is the version of Scum: The Food Chain Game with new rules, alliance, tactics and bluffing.

What is a kakapo? It is a parrot in serious danger of extinction: only 201 specimens left alive!

Principle of the game:
Kakapo is a game centered on this endangered Pacific parrot. A game sometimes unfair, always fun whose objective is to get rid of all your cards first to be crowned king.

A game of Asshole/President revisited with new rules for more atmosphere as well as more reflection.

A game with simple rules, enhanced by extensions: Rapido, Haka tapé, Vahiné, Putsch.

With this game, the publisher sponsors YWAM, a Kakapo (Kakapo Recovery organization Kakapo Recovery in New Zealand) and would like to multiply the sponsorships/donations according to the sales of the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Trodox (Issue 72 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb (translated with deepl):

48 pages A5 (main topic: solo adventures)

● The Dark Eye solo adventure Mahron's Death (28 pages - classic adventure in Fighting Fantasy style) ● Solo adventure The Way of the Quail (8 pages + link) ● Christmas solo adventure Santa's Torment or Murderer-Hannes gets no presents (2 pages - explicit) ● Report: Taran and the Magic Swamp ● News from the Scene ● Obituary On the Death of Ingo Schulze (Greifenklaue)
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Obituary: On the death of Ingo Schulze
Report: Taran and the Magic Swamp
Santa's Torment or Murderer-Hannes gets no presents

boardgame.name: Túlélők Viadala
boardgame.description:
Túlélők Viadala is an exciting quiz, trivia game in which survival is at stake. In a playful way, the game provides knowledge for solving unexpected situations that occur in everyday life, for which ordinary people may not be prepared.

During the game, you have to survive disaster situations hidden in the skin of different characters: in the event of a winter power outage lasting several days, after a plane crash in the jungle, or just during a zombie attack. In the first part of the game, the characters test their survival skills with quiz questions about emergencies and disasters. With correct answers, they get tools that they can use during the survival situation in the second part of the game. This is where the misfortune takes place, the stages of which can bring more and more plagues.

boardgame.name: Esoterroristas: Pack Pantalla y La Reina Carmesí
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tras seguir a un mendigo al interior de una tienda de compraventa, los personajes jugadores descubren el cuerpo sin vida de su propietario y un misterioso objeto desaparecido.
Cuando sigan la pista de los asesinos y el objeto robado se verán inmersos en una investigación a contrarreloj de tintes ocultistas que puede acabar en una masacre.
¿Llegarán a tiempo de prevenir el ascenso de la Reina Carmesí y hacerse un hueco entre las filas de la Ordo Veritatis?

¿QUÉ INCLUYE ESTE PACK?

Pantalla de tres cuerpos con toda la información necesaria para dirigir partidas de Esoterroristas.
Incluye las reglas de combate adicionales de la Guía definitiva del esoterror.
Aventura inédita de 20 páginas.

boardgame.name: La Chacolatería
boardgame.description:
La Chacolatería is a board game for 1-4 players in which you'll cooperate to run a café of chacorritos, adorable but very demanding creatures that will come to your place and order from you. Here there are no turns, but all the players will play at the same time, dividing the tasks if necessary and playing the correct command cards on the little ones that ask for them. If you manage to serve all the chacorritos before the time runs out (counted through a stopwatch or the official application), you will have won the game!
In the estimated time, you will have to seat the chacorritos at their tables, give them the complete orders from the hand of one of the players, clean their tables when everyone has been served (separate the order cards and chacorritos from that table) and wash the dishes if necessary (shuffle the order cards when they are finished). All this in a limited time where you will have to think fast and cooperate with your companions!
But that's not all, because many special levels await you with which to test yourselves as a team. You may have to serve the chacorritos in a buffet, or play with one less table, or you may not be able to speak to communicate during the game or even face your friends in the competitive levels. Are you ready? The chacorritos are waiting for you!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Uno: Justice League
boardgame.description:
It’s the family favorite card game you love, now enhanced with the power of the Justice League! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the deck.

There are two customizable cards and a special new wild card: the Superman X-Ray vision card! That card lets you look at any other player's cards and make strategic exchanges that pump up the excitement!

Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. First player or team to 500 wins. When you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO!" Contains 112 cards plus instructions. For 2 to 10 players, ages 7 and older. Easy to pick up, impossible to put down.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crónicas de Schuylkill: Agentes nuevos
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

¡Bienvenidos al condado de Schuylkill!

La Ordo Veritatis depende de diversos y complejos sistemas de análisis de información para localizar la actividad esoterrorista; a menudo, demasiado tarde. Por eso han puesto en marcha un plan piloto de estacionamiento de agentes en bases permanentes, y vosotros sois los elegidos para estableceros en la primera de ellas, en el condado de Schuylkill, en Pensilvania.

Esta primera temporada de Crónicas de Schuylkill, Agentes nuevos, consta de seis episodios que empiezan a desvelar la actividad esoterrorista de la zona micropolitana más grande del estado en la que rara vez ocurre nada… ¿o sí?


En el episodio piloto, los investigadores deben contener las ansias de atención y dinero de una madre después de que su hijo encuentre un rabo de lagartija en un bollo industrial.
En Black Dahlias, el equipo debe investigar un macabro asesinato demasiado parecido al de la «dalia negra».
Cuando se encuentra un cadáver en una mansión de un famoso hollywoodiense, los agentes se verán las caras con el archiconocido agente esoterrorista Legión.
En Croatoan, una llamada a urgencias que hace saltar las alarmas de AMINA les hace trabajar mano a mano con el operativo de la OV Caro Data Vermibus.
UZ: 7083: es un domingo cualquiera cuando los servicios de urgencias empiezan a registrar decenas de llamadas de lo que parece un ataque terrorista en un centro comercial, pero la Ordo ha desplegado a varios equipos FES a la zona…
En Operación Furia santa se precipita la contraofensiva en una aventura trepidante para FES.


Esta campaña sigue el marco de Estación base e incluye aventuras y ambientación exclusivas de la Guía definitiva del esoterror.

boardgame.name: Home is Where the Hearth Is
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hadbalt Bluffs were once a peaceful mountain range surrounded by woods with lush flora and thriving wildlife that acted as a lifeline for many surrounding villages and collectives of hunters and woodspeople. High in the mountains, a benevolent brass dragon oversaw the peace and tranquility of the land.

All was well until suddenly the ancient brass dragon stopped overseeing the lands below and volcanic earthquakes began to terrorize the land in a precursor of what was to come. Now the forest's wildlife has fled for safety, streams have dried up, and all seems to be lost. Can you ascend the summit and save the mountain and its surrounding woods?

Home is Where the Hearth Is is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 14th to 18th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 16.

This adventure contains 7 new monsters, 1 custom hand-drawn battlemap, 3 new magic items and 2 musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Robotta - Humanidad Perdida
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

En Robotta no se juega con humanos, los personajes son robottas, robots muy avanzados que poseen conciencia y emociones similares a las humanas. La clave de su conciencia es su Dáemyr, un software incomprensible para la mente humana que se comporta como un virus informático.

Robotta se ambienta en nuestro planeta, en un futuro indefinido en el tiempo. Suficientemente lejos como para que la humanidad sea un leve recuerdo, pero no tanto como para que las placas tectónicas hayan cambiado.

Los personajes jugadores forman una tripulación de amigos, una familia, y a bordo de su nave viajan por el mundo sobreviviendo y viviendo aventuras. La nave es un miembro más de la familia, su hogar y su compañera. Conseguir piezas para ella, mejorarla, arreglarla y combatir con ella es uno de los centros de la experiencia de juego, incluso se puede jugar siendo la nave.

El sistema de juego de Robotta se inspira en el maravilloso La Puerta de Ishtar, de Rodrigo García Carmona, y su ambientación bebe de decenas de mitos de culto como son Firefly, Cowboy Bebop, Han solo, Battlestar o Nausicaä del valle del Viento.

boardgame.name: Chaos and Capybaras
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world-renowned Euphoria Hot Springs Spa & Resort are known in equal parts for the year-round waters that sit at a constant near-boil perfect for relaxing tired muscles and soothing mind as well as their large population of capybaras which keep their denizens company. It would be the perfect place for a vacation if it weren't for the fact that the magical artifact that keeps the hot springs running goes missing in the middle of the night! Now it's up to you to find the culprit and return the mighty artifact to its rightful owners before the hot springs are closed for good! How will your party fare in Chaos and Capybaras?

Chaos and Capybaras is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 1st to 4th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 3.

This adventure contains 3 new monsters, 2 custom hand-drawn battlemaps, 1 custom magic item by Abyssal Brews and 2 epic musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Primal Forest (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

Wilderness Dressing: Primal Forest presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: One Hundred Plus Underworld Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's time to explore the criminal underworld of medieval fantasy adventure! Turn your cities into potential questing hubs by introducing an element of crime and underhanded dealings. Whether the PCs are criminals themselves, or if they are simply in the wrong place at the wrong time, the secretive and cutthroat world of crime provides countless mysteries of murders, greed, burglaries, corruption, smuggling, and more.
Presented here are 100 unique criminal underworld plot hooks that are focused on narrative-building roleplay. This list will help you introduce challenge and intrigue into your campaigns in a more nuanced and believable way.
This is an essential tool and reference that a GM will be able to use over and over again.
1d100 underworld events for memorable roleplaying situations
Supernatural / magic references are kept to a bare minimum – gives you full control of the tone of your game
Almost exclusively non-combat content – keep using your favorite random encounter tables
Includes 8 extensive additional support tables for added detail and depth
Perfect for slice of life, OSR, historical, and medieval fantasy games
System Agnostic – use with your favorite RPGs

boardgame.name: 3, 2, 1... Action! Rule Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3,2,1...Action Rule Book is everything you need to be a Game Runner or player in any 3,2,1...Action! adventure. You can also use these rules as the basis to tell your own story in any style you'd like.

boardgame.name: Escape From Point Nemo
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A documentary film crew was lost at sea and shipwrecked on a Mysterious Island full of monsters and intrigue. An Evil Lurking in the jungle, stalking them in a deadly game. A Billionaire who knows more than he seems, and his bodyguards struggling to keep him alive.

This is Escape from Point Nemo.

Escape from Point Nemo is a SciFi survival adventure game played using the 321 Action system. It's an intuitive system that puts the focus on fun > physics.

boardgame.name: Rocket To Russia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A madman is running amok on a mysterious island, where super-science has gone horribly wrong, and carnivorous creatures are chowing down on the soldiers stationed there. You are a member of a clandestine clean-up crew sent in to clear the air of this tropical hell before the clock runs out!

Rocket To Russia is a Sci-Fi Survival Adventure one-shot RPG — in the vein of Contra and Predator — set on a strange island in the middle of nowhere.

Rocket is played using the brand new 3,2,1...Action! RPG system where the focus is always on story and fun over physics.

boardgame.name: Fallen & Reborn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forces That Can Save or Destroy the World!

Twenty years after the Darkfall, there are strange and mysterious forces at work in the Known Lands of Aden. The greatest and most dangerous is the Darkfall itself, capable of creating the innumerable horrors known as nocturnals to enact its mission of spreading death, destruction, and fear. Those who embrace it are known as the Corrupted, the worst traitors of history. And then there are the Fallen, who are touched by its but throw off its shackles and maintain their own mind. The Channelers have likewise returned to Aden after countless eons, their powers as much a mystery now as they were then. And of course, the scions of both past and future, the thaumaturges and seers, remain active to whatever extent they are able.

Fallen & Reborn introduces both the Fallen and the Channelers to the world of Thunderscape TinyD6, with all the rules necessary to play such characters in a new or ongoing campaign. Their history, such as it is known and tragic through it may be, is included as well, along with rules for both nocturnals and the corrupted. Seer and thaumaturge characters from the core rules also receive expanded backgrounds and new mechanics to increase options for players. And of course there are a few thrown in just for good measure!

Will They Be the World's Heroes, or Its Villains?
boardgame.rpg: Thunderscape: The World of Aden TinyD6

boardgame.name: Dwarf Mine: Barrier Mountains
boardgame.description:
The Barrier Mountains are the site of a strange falling star from years ago! Your mine will strike the earth at the Barrier Mountains, and uncover the secrets of an ancient artifact buried deep below. Will you discover its secrets? Or will your mine fall to the odd creatures that inhabit these mountains? Play to find out, as your mine tells its story!

Barrier Mountains is an expansion to Dwarf Mine (the Dwarf Mine base game is required to play).

Like Dwarf Mine, Barrier Mountains is a game played by drawing a mine on graph paper. On your turn, you will first draw (dig) rooms, hallways, and ladders for your mine! Rooms will benefit your mine, and hallways and ladders let you reach other areas of your mountain.

After drawing, you will make two dice rolls - a treasure roll, and a combat roll. These rolls determine what treasure you find, and what creatures you may encounter in the mountain - after all, mining is dangerous business!

Each mine made has a story, and every story has a beginning, middle, and sadly, an end. Your game ends when your population reaches 0. By the end of the game, you’ll have created rich and unique history for your mine – no two games are the same!

Players are getting VP during the game and trying to see how many VP they can get each time they play. Kind of like a high score.

Barrier Mountains expands on this experience, by offering a sci-fi style of gameplay, which includes:
A brand new Dwarf Mine map
4 new rooms for your Dwarf Mine
4 new final bosses to fight
4 new Treasure Tables (one for each mine level)
4 new Combat Tables (one for each mine level)
New mechanics unique to this map

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dwarf Mine

boardgame.name: Village: Big Box
boardgame.description:
Life in the village is hard, but life here also allows the inhabitants to grow and prosper as they please. One villager might want to become a friar. Another might feel ambitious and strive for a career in public office. A third one might want to seek their luck in distant lands.

In Village, each player takes the reins of a family and attempts to help them find fame and glory in many different ways. There is one thing you must not forget, however: Time will not stop for anyone, and given enough time people will vanish. Those who find themselves immortalized in the village chronicles will bring honor to their family and be one step closer to victory.

In more detail, each turn you take a cube from an area on the game board, then take the action of that area. The board has zones with specific attributes, a market, a travel zone, a crafting zone, a church, and a council house, and each zone is seeded with cubes of four colors as well as black cubes that serve as curses. Many of these areas offer multiple actions, so if for example you take a cube from the crafting area, you can get an ox, a horse, a cart, a plow, or a scroll, or you can convert wheat to gold. Some areas offer short-term scoring, others offer long-term scoring, and still others offer only endgame scoring. The round ends when no cubes remain at any location. The game ends when either the village chronicle or the anonymous graveyard is full.

Village: Big Box contains the Village base game, the Inn and Port expansions, every promo previously released, and a new "Marriage" expansion, with all of the materials being integrable with one another and with the game now containing a solo mode as well as revised gameplay, dual-layered player boards, and a larger, double-sided main board that eliminates the need for the overlays used in the original expansions.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Booster Brick
boardgame.description:
This 5-figure booster release features many hotly-demanded and fan-favorite sub-themes like the Justice League, the Seven Soldiers of Victory, the Injustice League, the Justice Lords, and the Superfriends! Justice League Unlimited will also feature never-before-seen Team Up cards! These cards will be a rare bonus 6th character card that come inside some boosters, and give you the option during team-building of using a super-charged version of the character if they show up with the right mix of their teammates!

Existing and new HeroClix fans will get to power-up their collection with fan-favorites and never-before-Clixed characters, including Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, Darkseid, Static, Amazo, Blight, Batman Beyond, Captain Atom, Emil Hamilton, Booster Gold, and more!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Wonder Woman 80th Anniversary Booster Brick
boardgame.description:
Wonder Woman 80th Anniversary has more exciting Captains and Sidekicks – more than 15 in total!

Every booster will come with 5 pre-painted figures and select boosters will come with a bonus equipment-objects like Wonder Woman’s Bracelets, the Lasso of Truth or Lantern Constructs to use on your HeroClix team!

With more than 80 figures and equipment to collect including 12 Chase figures, this is going to be one of the most exciting HeroClix sets to collect ever! Powerful female characters from across DC Comics are also featured in this set – Mary Shazam, Star Sapphire, Teen Lantern, Jessica Cruz, and Supergirl!

Wonder Woman 80th Anniversary is a great set for beginners since lots of Common and Uncommon figures have straightforward play that you’ll be able to bolster with other figures for more powerful play!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set

boardgame.name: Dolorous Edd
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dolorous Edd is a new bestiary entry which describes an odd creature for use in your game of RuneQuest: Roleplaying in Glorantha—a giant beast ruled by inscrutable instincts. Included in this supplement are:

A description of Dolorous Edd's appearance, behavior, and abilities
A collection of rumors and scenario seeds to help introduce him to your Glorantha
How adventurers may establish a spirit cult honoring this creature
Several folktales illustrating Dolorous Edd's behavior, and what Gloranthans of the Dragon Pass region believe about him

boardgame.name: Storm Rams
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Filling the Air from horizon to horizon, the noble Storm Rams are a new spirit for your game of RuneQuest. They are the embodiment of rain-giving clouds, found anywhere throughout Glorantha. Included in this supplement are:

A description of what the Orlanthi believe about these spirits
The bestiary detailing storm rams, lightning rams, cloud sheep, and advice on how to create your own unique, more powerful variations
One minor magic item—the heat-relieving Mistwool
An alternative perspective from Prax, including a brief spirit cult

boardgame.name: Children of Melikaphkaz
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This month's issue of Monster of the Month previews material from a forthcoming work for the Jonstown Compendium, Melikaphkaz: the O-God of Traps. Melikaphkaz is a Darkness god worshiped by those who build traps and defenses to create shelter in a hostile world.

Within this supplement is contained:

A short-form cult dedicated to the titular deity (including two new Rune spells) suitable for adventurers and antagonists alike.
Three monsters for the gamemaster's use: treasure-possessing bargouns, enslaved dwarven ghosts (the cult's Spirit of Reprisal) and dreadful demons, the sons of Melikaphkaz and his immortal troll wife.
Further rules are included for using these creatures as cult spirits—in particular when bonding with a bargoun or darkness elemental (found in the Glorantha Bestiary) as an allied spirit.

May the Sheltering Dark protect you all!

boardgame.name: Air Toads!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Air Toads! brings an amphibian with explosive temper to your games of RuneQuest. A cousin of the common cliff toad, air toads can be found on mountain crags and in sullen marshes anywhere in Glorantha.

This supplement includes:

An essay on the behavior and biology of air toads
Advice for the gamemaster, including adventure seeds and "The Proper Use of a Deceased Air Toad"
Brief perspectives from non-Orlanthi cultures
And printer-friendly handouts for ease of use at your table.

boardgame.name: The Quacken
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Quacken introduces a terrible new sea monster to your RuneQuest bestiary. This leviathan-sized issue of MOTM includes:

A full description of the quacken, including a juvenile and a truly legendary variant, based upon the best knowledge Lhankor Mhy can look up
The coastal settlement of Stone Dock Village, a movable micro-setting including a map and three non-player characters
Clash with the Quacken, an adventure intended to provide one to two sessions of play, which pits the adventurers against the powers of the Sea
Plus illustrations of squiddy horror, portraits of most major non-player characters, and printer-friendly handouts of their description for the gamemaster

This supplement includes everything the gamemaster needs to put the fear of Magasta into their adventurers!

boardgame.name: Shaivalla, Well-Loved
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This month's "monster" inaugurates a series presenting powerful Rune Masters for your game of RuneQuest. Shaivalla is a power-hungry priestess of Ernalda. Inside, you'll find her history and motives, a magic item, and the retinue which accompanies her throughout Dragon Pass.

boardgame.name: Renharth Blackveins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This month's issue of Monster of the Month continues the series of Rune Masters begun last month. Inside, you'll find a terrifying Sword of Humakt, Renharth Blackveins. Raised under the rule of the Lunar invaders, Renharth embodies patriotism without hatred, antagonism with respect. In addition to describing Renharth, this issue includes:

Gamemaster advice for using this new Rune Master, including adventure seeds to inspire immediate play
Several cult spirits Renharth has bound, including the Nightmare of the Inevitable Path, which threatens all who see it with visions of their death
A new subcult, Humakt Indomitable, suitable for adventurers and antagonists alike
Two additional non-player characters, and directions for Renharth's retinue in war and peace

Although most of this supplement is usable with the core rulebook alone, you’ll need a copy of The Red Book of Magic from Chaosium in order to use the new subcult included herein.

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, The Flash, Green Lantern, and Martian Manhunter band together for this brand-new HeroClix starter set!

This boxed-set is a great way for 1 to 4 players to learn HeroClix! Play with the contents of this starter set or combine it with other HeroClix figures for even more fun!

This starter set contains everything up to 4 people need to play HeroClix.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Fast Forces
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Rebirth Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker's Wild Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Wonder Woman 80th Anniversary Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: World's Finest Booster Brick

boardgame.name: Vajra of the Skies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Continuing our series of Rune Masters, this month's issue of Monster of the Month presents a shaman of the Golden Bow. Vajra is a grief-stricken elder of the Pure Horse People who wanders the skies of Dragon Pass on the back of the great vrok hawk Sunfriend. He is designed to allow the gamemaster to use him as a tragic antagonist, a flawed mentor, or with a blending of themes.

In addition to describing Vajra, this issue includes:

A sidebar discussing Drugs in Glorantha, including optional Addiction rules, and four new intoxicants

The Sun Horse's Mane, a magic item woven by worshipers of Yu-Kargzant the Sun Horse

Two minor spirits associated with Light—Whisperstars and Illumes

boardgame.name: Black Ship of the Sunless
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

As a larger body of work, Black Ship of the Sunless has a central theme – corrupted history. This first episode, Black Waters, serves as the inciting incident, transitioning your players from reality to the surrealistic version of the island of Cozumel on the Yucatán peninsula in the year 1519. The player’s ship is about to smash into a coral reef and find themselves marooned and trapped at the footsteps of a pre-Columbian Maya temple at Tantum Cuzamil.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Wenkarleos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fourth installment in MOTM's mini-series of Rune Masters is Wenkarleos, a Lunar Tarshite noble and Rune Lord of the Seven Mothers. A confidante of King Pharandros of Tarsh, Wenkarleos provides the gamemaster with opportunities supporting adventures about the Tarsh Civil War between the patriotic heroes of King Pharandros, and the traitorous sons of General Fazzur Wideread.

In addition to describing Wenkarleos, this issue includes:

The Philigos Medallions, made by good King Phargentes to commemorate his brother's death at the swords of Orlanthi assassins—an excellent Family Heirloom for adventurers from Lunar Tarsh!
Several supporting characters, including Wenkarleos's lover Beautiful Orland, and the Pelorian sorcerer Darveya the Far-Seeing. Darveya is accompanied with notes and advice for playing a sorcerer in RuneQuest, applicable to gamemasters and players of sorcerer adventurers alike.

boardgame.name: Ehnval Tallspear
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the last two Rune Masters of this six-issue MOTM run, our attention turns to the Elder Races of Glorantha. This supplement presents Ehnval Tallspear, a stern Wood Lord of Aldrya. Found near his native woods north of Esrolia, his description includes advice and adventure seeds for the gamemaster for use as either friend or foe.

In addition to describing Ehnval, this issue includes:

Treasures galore, from a collection of minor Elvish Trinkets to a description of the Living Copper cultivated in dryad groves and rarely seen by humankind.
A cast of peculiar side characters—Andovar, a lovelorn Yelmalion elf, the irascible Ancient Runner, and the talking bear Borulgus.

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Rebirth Booster Brick
boardgame.description:
DC Rebirth is DC Comics most recent reboot of the entire DC Universe that re-imagines many of the most iconic heroes and villains in a stunning, new light! This exciting interpretation of the DC Universe includes new iterations of the usual suspects from the Justice League, JSA, and Teen Titans as well as new and exciting themes like Deathstroke’s Defiance, Justice League China, and the Dark Trinity of Bizarro, Red Hood, and Artemis!

Long-time HeroClix fans will be ecstatic to see many never-before-clixed characters like Power Girl, The Signal, Colonel Poison, Bumblebee, Cyclone, Commander Steel, Shade the Changing Girl, Jessica Cruz, and Flex Mentallo alongside their favorite, iconic characters!

Much like when readers saw the DC Rebirth comics for the first time – we’re sure there are going to be some BIG surprises as they open these boosters!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set

boardgame.name: Grungnak Fearless
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A truly monstrous Rune Master is presented in this last issue of MOTM's mini-series of Rune Masters. Grungnak Fearless is a brutal Death Lord of Zorak Zoran, the God of Hate and Vengeance. She has risen from lowly bandit origins to shake up the status quo of Glorantha's classic "adventurer's playground," the Big Rubble. This dangerous antagonist and her berserk followers will provide a challenge even to experienced adventurers.

In addition to describing Grungnak, this issue includes:

Stolen Fire, a magic item reflecting Zorak Zoran's perspective in the famous Yelmalion myth, the Hill of Gold
The Death Lord's lover, Bazzik Fineteeth, and her young insect warden, Fenhield Mantis-Friend
A short-form Rune cult of Gorakiki the Insect Mother in her aspect as Gorakiki-mantis, suitable for gamemaster and player use alike!

boardgame.name: Donkey Valley
boardgame.description:
Is a donkey going to make it up the steep walls of the Grand Canyon? Normally? Yes. But you and your fellow donkey handlers need to get loads up to the top of the route as well. You need to have a keen eye for how much each donkey can carry. Make the right calls, use the favors of employees at the best time and deny contracts that you don’t believe in.

In Donkey Valley every round there is a different donkey that needs to be loaded with luggage. Each donkey can have a specific effect that influences how much they can carry. Players play face down load cards and make a call if they believe the donkey is overloaded or not. If they made the right call, they earn points and after eight rounds the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Donkey Valley Publisher: Jolly Dutch Productions Language(s): English German French Dutch

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Rebirth Fast Forces
boardgame.description:
Celebrate the release of DC Comics HeroClix: DC Rebirthwith a new Fast Forces set featuring the Justice League. DC Comics’ most powerful and prolific superhero team reunites with all-new dials and two never-before-clixed characters from the Justice League of China: Super-Man (Kenan Kong) and Bat-Man (Wang Baixi). In this Fast Forces, you will also find core Justice League characters like Aquaman, Cyborg, The Flash, and Wonder Woman!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
boardgame.description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: Batman The Animated Series Starter Set includes two iconic superheroes from the Bat Family and four of Batman’s most notorious enemies with all-new dials! This Starter Set features the namesake of the set, Batman, as well as his always trusty sidekick, Robin, both ready to take down crime in Gotham! Their malevolent counterparts include Catwoman, Harley Quinn, Poison Ivy, and the ever-sinister The Joker!

Along with these six fantastic figures, this Starter Set includes everything a player needs to learn and start playing HeroClix today! From the figures, to a HeroClix Rulebook, two double-sided Maps, a Powers and Abilities Card (PAC), Object Tokens, Terrain Tokens, Dice, and Character Cards. Get this unbelievable Starter Set today to start playing HeroClix or bolster your ever-growing collection!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Fast Forces
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Rebirth Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker's Wild Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Wonder Woman 80th Anniversary Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: World's Finest Booster Brick
boardgame.boardgamefamily: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Booster Brick
boardgame.description:
Batman: The Animated Series was the Batman of a generation. It’s consistently praised by critics, and was nominated for more than 20 awards during its run. More than 25 years later, it’s still one of the top superhero cartoons of all-time. For the first time ever, these versions of your favorite Batman characters come to HeroClix!

In addition to the heroes and villains of Gotham, fans will be delighted to learn that there are characters from Justice League Unlimited, Batman Beyond, and the Super-Friends! The HeroClix team has taken special care to showcase characters from beloved episodes that have never been Clixed before like Zeta, Leslie Thompkins, Maxie Zeus, Kyodai Ken, The Clock King, The Phantasm, Riddler’s Robot Minotaur, Apache Chief, and others!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: TV Shows: Batman – The Animated Series
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick
boardgame.description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick includes the biggest icons of girl power in the DC Comics Universe from classic characters like Wonder Woman to newer characters like Harley Quinn and her hyenas. HeroClix fans will get to enjoy all-new versions of Harley Quinn, DC Bombshell versions of beloved heroines, and extra-dangerous members of the Suicide Squad. Whether you’re in the streets of Gotham, outer space, or Arkham Asylum, Harley and her crew will help you bring action and mayhem to the HeroClix tabletop like never before!

With more than 60 figures to collect, DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick is sure to be on many HeroClix players’ wish lists.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Fast Forces
boardgame.description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Fast Forces features 6 HeroClix figures with all-new dial designs, focusing on the Thrillkiller storyline from Elseworlds. This pack is perfect for Harley Quinn and Batman fans alike and an excellent product for new and established players!
This Fast Forces features Harley Quinn, The Joker, Batgirl, Robin, Batman, and a GCPD Officer.

Fast Forces packs are designed for quick play and easy team building, for both tournaments and casual games.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
boardgame.description:
With the 15th Anniversary of HeroClix, WizKids is excited to reveal DC heroes as seen in the pages of Elseworlds!

The DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set includes the most iconic DC heroes. A great introduction to HeroClix for rookies, a useful teaching tool for experienced stores, and a fresh look at iconic characters for HeroClix veterans!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Fast Forces
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Rebirth Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker's Wild Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: Wonder Woman 80th Anniversary Booster Brick
DC Comics HeroClix: World's Finest Booster Brick

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Booster Brick
boardgame.description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Booster Brick includes the most iconic DC heroes and villains of all time, exactly as you’d expect them to be, and with incredible alternate versions too. HeroClix fans can explore a world in which Kal-El was raised by the Waynes, or Diana Prince as a marshal in the Wild West. See your favorite characters in ways never before possible on the HeroClix tabletop! Themes shift from settings in Gotham to Egypt, the Daily Planet to the basketball court, and more! Explore these destinations and the personalities found in the alternate universe of DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds.

With 50 figures to collect, DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds is sure to be on many HeroClix players’ wish list.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set

boardgame.name: DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker's Wild Booster Brick
boardgame.description:
The Most Maniacal Madman in Gotham Takes Over in… DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker‘s Wild!
Open the asylum— it’s time for the inmates to run amok! The DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker‘s Wild! set features The Joker, The Riddler, The Penguin, Mr. Freeze and a cadre of other iconic Gotham City villains who have continuously challenged it’s harrowed hero— Batman. Additional sub-themes include the Justice Society of America, The Outsiders and The Suicide Squad. The DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker‘s Wild! set also features a selection of character using ClixFX bases— an easy way to track on-going game and environmental effects!

The DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker‘s Wild! set has 70 figures to collect. The DC Comics HeroClix: The Joker‘s Wild! Booster Bricks include ten (10) 5-figure booster packs.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Starter Set
DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set

boardgame.name: Kaos (Issue 2 - Nov 1991)
boardgame.description:
Kaos
Anno 1 Numero 2
Novembre 1991

boardgame.name: The World of Greyhawk Magic Item Compendium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Magical Items of Oerth

A 3.5 Edition D&D Conversion

[V]arious magical items and artifacts from the World of Greyhawk campaign setting that have not [yet] been officially converted.

boardgame.name: Compounded: The Peer-Reviewed Edition
boardgame.description:
Compounded is a game about building chemical compounds through careful management of elements, a fair bit of social play and trading, and just a bit of luck.

In Compounded, players take on the roles of lab managers, hastily competing to complete the most compounds before they are completed by others — or destroyed in an explosion. Some compounds are flammable and will grow more and more volatile over time; take too long to gather the necessary elements for those compounds, and a lot of hard work will soon be scattered across the lab.

Although Compounded does involve a fair share of press-your-luck tension and certainly some strategic planning, the most successful scientists will often be those who strike a good trade with their fellow lab mates. Players are able to freely trade elements, laboratory tools, and even favors — if there is truly honor among chemists!

In the ten years since Compounded debuted, designer Darrell Louder and publisher Greater Than Games have developed and refined the design to streamline gameplay, increase player interaction, and include more real-world facts. Compounded: The Peer-Reviewed Edition is a game about scientists grappling for recognition on the edge of known chemistry and getting credit for their discoveries, all while competing for limited resources and striking deals with the competition to ensure their work gets done.

Compounded: The Peer-Reviewed Edition features new compounds, new tool tiles and rules, revised lab fire interaction, redesigned lab benches, and more. Everything in this new build of Compounded has been tweaked in some way.

boardgame.name: Book of Everything
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A compilation of various game materials, including an analysis of fae, suggestions for building character wealth, comments on equipment, and brief campaign notes.

boardgame.name: Spin (Issue 13 - Apr 1989)
boardgame.description:
Spin
4/1989

boardgame.name: TSR Worlds (Issue 1 - Jun-Dec 1987)
boardgame.description:
TSR Worlds
From the Leader in Adventure Publishing
Issue 1
June-December 1987

TSR SLASHES PRICES!

boardgame.name: Petty Spirits 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this month's issue of MOTM, our attention returns to the smaller scale of Glorantha. Petty spirits provide unusual explanations for in-world phenomena: Bookwyrms plunder libraries, Children of Daga cause liquids to evaporate, and Child's Fortune presents mischievous imaginary friends to children.

Each of these spirits provide texture to the mythic world of Glorantha by both subverting, and supporting, our terrestrial "common sense." They're suitable for use by both gamemasters and player adventurers alike.

boardgame.name: The Bad Winds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What’s the worst that can happen when you fumble the spell Summon Cult Spirit?

This issue of MOTM answers that question with a species of Orlanth's disease-riddled relatives. The Bad Winds are umbroli deceived and corrupted by the goddess of disease, Mallia. They wield her magic to bully mortals across Glorantha into "loving" them with propitiatory sacrifices.

Inside, you'll find:

A description of the Bad Winds
A short spirit cult illustrating how shamans of Kolat protect communities
Narrative advice for gamemasters using Bad Winds in their adventures
A short myth to inspire your own heroquesting, "Kolat Vanquishes the Bad Winds"

boardgame.name: Jallupel Goodwind
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Years ago, a Lunar Hero and a Wind Lord of Orlanth fought a terrific battle which led to their mutual demise. Buried together in a single grave, the mingled remains wove their souls together. Now this tormented ghost haunts the dreaded Valley of the Blight, in the lands of the Cinsina Tribe.

In this issue's "mini-adventure," your adventurers will get to:

Fight or heal the wounded souls of two Heroes
Discover the secrets of their fatal duel
Strive to restore the Valley's Fertility—returning its spirits to Ernalda's bosom!

boardgame.name: The Salt Man
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Salt Man is a creature which should be impossible. It is the birth of a barren womb. It is the seed of an impotent sire. It is dryness and drought, a walking extinction which pretends to live. This issue of MOTM describes a Praxian horror, its legends, the rites performed to appease it.

boardgame.name: Burning Engines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Burning Engines are a rare and dangerous protector of dwarven catacombs. Mostali technicians bind spirits of fire within lifeless hulks of metal, creating immortal guardians capable of roasting pesky adventurers. This RuneQuest supplement describes three "species" of burning engine, new sorcery spells for Lhankor Mhy adventurers to command a burning engine of their own, and an adventure seed which pits players against a fallen star driven mad by The Dwarf with the pain of its binding.

boardgame.name: To Hunt a God
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 'monster-sized' final issue in the MOTM series is stuffed to the gills with Gloranthan goodness! Inside these pages you'll find:

A new cult which worships Hrunda, a protector god of the Old Woods to the north of Esrolia. Useful for adventurers and gamemasters alike, Hrunda's cult is fully detailed with myths, traditions, and new Rune magic allowing worshipers to transform into devious monkeys! An appendix on the cult and heroquesting is included to inspire further adventures.
The eerie Temple of the Bones where humans and Animal People worship the spirits of nature side-by-side. Capricious shamans and animal-shaped spirits have this holy site primed for exploration by adventurers.
Finally, the series finale—a full-length adventure. In To Hunt a God, the adventurers attend a magical festival, then are swept away into the mythic landscape of the Old Woods hunting for a half-mad god.
Fleshed out with supplemental detail—such as the "delicious" Ludvik's Liquor, or Esrolian athletic traditions—and lovingly illustrated, To Hunt a God gives the series a proper finale. Our heartfelt thanks to the RuneQuest community for supporting this series the last two years.

This book currently includes Part One of the titular adventure. Part Two will be released during 2022, and will be a free update to everyone who has previously purchased To Hunt a God. When Part Two is released, this supplement's price will also increase. The Cult of Hrunda and the Temple of the Bones, however, are completed are ready for the table!

boardgame.name: Day at the Races
boardgame.description:
The horses are lined up and under Starter's Orders... and they're OFF!

Now all you can do is watch and shout encouragement as the mighty steeds thunder around the track, racing towards the finish line. Will you have backed the winner?

boardgame.name: The Secrets of Scaravore
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the time before humanity, even before the rise of Gallifrey, Scaravore was imprisoned for its crimes. Last of a long dead species, it slumbered, sending its influence out into the stars. Now it seeks to rise again, to extend its evil dominion over the galaxy.

The Secrets of Scaravore is a collection of four new adventures that can be played as standalone episodes, or as a series of connected stories that lead the characters to the Wild West and distant worlds, encountering Draconians, Silurians, Zygons, and more, before finally facing the terrifying Scaravore itself.

Discover the dark secrets of a technology advanced Paradise occupied by seemingly prehistoric people, and unwind the tragic plot of a Dalek plague in Paradise Lost.
Marooned on a strange planet where advanced technology doesn’t work, your Team TARDIS will have to unravel the mysteries of an apparently magical mediaeval society and solve an interplanetary diplomatic crisis in A Kind of Magic.
Travel the Oregon Trail with a wagon train filled with refugee aliens in Westward Bound, and protect their secrets from a sect of deadly bounty hunters.


Buried deep beneath the streets of modern day London, a nightmarish creature stretches its malign influence across space and time… only a team of terrific time travellers can stop it in The Mandala of Scaravore!
boardgame.rpg: Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game Second Edition

boardgame.name: Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game Second Edition Gamemaster's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gamemaster’s Screen for Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game is the ideal addition to every Gamemaster’s collection. Perfect for the Gamemaster who likes to keep their plots a secret from their players, the Gamemaster’s Screen contains a wealth of useful information.

The Gamemaster’s Screen is a three-panel landscape screen with a stunning image of the Doctor’s recent incarnations, which will inspire your players to ask themselves, ‘What would the Doctor do?’ The interior contains the most used rules and tables, handy for both novice and seasoned Gamemasters to refer to in the middle of an epic adventure without slowing things down.

A 36-page booklet is also included. This fact-packed resource features advice for the Gamemaster, and a host of references and guidance to create memorable adventures at very short notice, along with a handful of exciting adventure hooks to get you started.
boardgame.rpg: Doctor Who: The Roleplaying Game Second Edition

boardgame.name: NPCs: Wanted 10
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be wanted by the law or other authorities.

For in-person games, print out these pages and clip out a Wanted poster as a handout. For virtual games, show your players the section of the file for the fugitive you want them aware of.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Female druid Brookbabble wanted for questioning
Male half-orc Gur'uk wanted for illegally selling potions
Gad Rocknocker, male dwarf, wanted for treasonous speech
Capture a male ranger and his giant lizard companion, get 250 gold

boardgame.name: Cyber Seeds: Collection 09
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oy, budzo! Are you running a game of Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, The Sprawl, or something similar? Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Cyber Seed.

This is the Nation Collection, choomba! Brief details of nine groups of people - mostly political or militant - open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A white supremacist group who mostly kept their hate online, until they didn't.
An org fighting for reproductive and sexual rights across the world.
An organization of criminals that has taken gender prejudice issues to heart.
People who believe that augmenting human bodies to make them "better" should be legal.

boardgame.name: Masher
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Run for your friggin' life! The masher is upon us!

This is our 12th Monday Mutant of an initial 12 group freakopedia.

These brutes stand nine feet tall, weigh over a thousand pounds, have ballistic skin, adapt their pigmentation to their surroundings, exhibit other random mutations from a rich d20 selection, and live on an all-meat diet with a preference for generic humans.

This is our biggest Monday mutant yet at 9 pages. It features 5 Adventure hooks, a d20 'loot carried' table, and as a bonus, another d20 table offering the game master random goodies and weirdness that is found in the bone littered depths of a masher lair. Careful though, these giants of the epoch are known to hunt in packs, use ambushes, bait, and mimicry to lure the unwary to a swift end.

boardgame.name: Wyngdeth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:
