Short for ‘winged death’, these rock colored, feral bio-weapons are among the most dreaded newcomers to the Epochian wilderness. Their sharp claws, swiftness, and three neuro-toxin filled tail stingers and make these winged mutants more than a match for most new dig teams.

Yet, it is what they do with subdued humans which is their most terrifying feature. Evidence of their cruelty is easy enough to find, for up on their bone strewn nest mounds the booted feet of past victims stick out from the grave-like holes in the clay.

Questions arise. What awful ending did these people face? Why are they head first in the side of a cliff? What horrors linger here, and so too, what valuables?

The Wyngdeth PDF is an 8 page creature supplement that covers three life stages of this horrific, fast moving mutant monstrosity; the winged adult, the man-sized pupa, and wriggling cat-sized larva. Also included are two random loot tables: a 1d20 scattered mound discoveries and the 1d12 gruesome nest discoveries table... both of which are strewn with a mix of valuables, curiosities and perils. These former bio-weapons aren’t any bigger than a man, but extremely tough and are among the fastest predators in the wasteland. They can make 5 attacks per round, are almost impossible to run from, and with +5 initiative, are hard to hit before they’re on you.

boardgame.name: Role-play Floor Plans
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Role-play Floor Plans were full color, heavy cardstock images of various common types of terrain, flooring, and furnishings. They were intended to be cut and assembled to support tabletop gaming as a type of "geomorph" battlemap.

boardgame.name: Pagan: Die alten Prozesse
Pagan: Trials of Old
boardgame.description:
The Trials of Old content pack expands the base game by casting a spotlight on the investigative aspects of Pagan: Fate of Roanoke. As the Hunter employs new methods of intense scrutiny, the Witch has a few new tricks up their sleeve to avoid detection and accelerate the ritual process.

Contents: 16 Hunter cards, 16 Witch Cards

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Pagan: Fate of Roanoke

boardgame.name: Voll auf die 18
boardgame.description:
Voll auf die 18 is a funny, co-operative, and chaotic kangaroo card game with dice that also offers 100 good arguments against Nazis.

Two to five players aged ten and up take on the roles of kangaroos, small artists or other members of the "anti-social network". Together they want to convince Nazis to make the world a little better. Each Nazi has an individual IQ. The players have to play cards with arguments (and numbers from 1 to 6), the sum of which corresponds exactly to the IQ of the respective Nazi. It is possible to "argue" alone or together. Some Nazis have a soft spot for certain things (for example, card suits) and bring further specifications into play. In addition, each character has its own rules of play that must be followed. The game is accompanied by an app that provides 18 increasingly difficult levels and also acts as a timer as new Nazis appear at regular intervals. The group loses if it has been surrounded by Nazis. If, on the other hand, all Nazis could be convinced within the time limit, the players win together.

boardgame.name: Planted: A Game of Nature & Nurture
boardgame.description:
In this game of nature & nurture, make your house beautiful by caring for your very own collection of houseplants! In this easy-to-learn board game, collect your favorite plants and they try to feed them every round with the right combination of light, water, and plant food.
Planted features 42 varieties of popular and exotic houseplants, each with their own requirements to grow. Discover various planting tools and decorations to help you raise beautiful, thriving plants, and score bonus points. The player, or plant parent, that ends up scoring the most points from growing their plants is declared the game’s biggest green thumb - and winner!

Some features:

Easy to learn mechanics for all ages strategy
Collect resource tokens to care for your nursery (water drop, sun chip, plant food, etc.)
Features 42 popular and various plant varieties for all levels of plant parents including the fiddle leaf fig, philodendron, ZZ plant, monstera, croton, and more!
Created by famed game designer Phil Walker-Harding


—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Pagan: Close Encounters
Pagan: Harsche Methoden
boardgame.description:
The Close Encounters content pack expands the base game by casting a spotlight on the harsh life within the village in Pagan: Fate of Roanoke. The Hunter’s overwhelming presence is really taking its toll, as ever more Roanokeans are living their lives in fear - if not shackles. A kind word here, a surreptitious suggestion there, has the civilian sentiment shifting in the Witch’s favor, while turning the Hunter’s efforts against themselves.

Contents: 16 Hunter cards, 16 Witch Cards

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Pagan: Fate of Roanoke

boardgame.name: Junior Detective
boardgame.description:
Ready, Detectives? Solve this all-ages WHODUNNIT!
Curious things have been happening in the neighborhood, and it needs the smartest detectives to solve the case!
Choose the mystery for each game from 40 unsolved case files. Decode clues using your trusty detective gear like your red spy glass, detective mirror, cipher solve card, and even the magic of your own hand! Be the first to identify the culprit and where they are hiding by interviewing neighborhood witnesses and taking notes.
BUT be careful! Not all witnesses are telling the truth.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pagan: Gedankenspiele
Pagan: Mind Games
boardgame.description:
The Mind Games content pack expands the base game by bringing an abundance of new opportunities and challenges to Pagan: Fate of Roanoke. Whether you are looking to have your opponent second-guessing your every move or to add some extra spice to your convoluted schemes, these cards are sure to satisfy the needs of both Hunter and Witch.

Contents: 16 Hunter cards, 16 Witch Cards
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Pagan: Fate of Roanoke

boardgame.name: Dragstrip Showdown: Roll & Write
boardgame.description:
Introduction:
Heat your tires with a good burnout, Stage Your car slowly as you pull up to the starting line, wait for the other driver, amber lights start dropping on the Christmas tree……… yellow……. Yellow……. Yellow……. Green……… full throttle as its time to go….go.…. go.
Hope All is Good and No Major Issues Along the Way to the Finish!
Coming up on the finish, it’s going to be close, cross your fingers and pray the win light comes on. The sport of drag racing is one of the most exciting, entertaining, and fastest past-times in history. Dragstrip Showdown- Roll & Write brings this exciting entertainment to your table top in a quick playing one to two player game.

Overview:
This is a roll and write game using dice and offering fun good decisions to try and cross the finish line first before your competition. Each round, a pool of dice gets rolled and players take turns selecting one die at a time marking the results off on the various player mat tracks which can gain movement, events, and other special actions gained. Players have up to six turns/12 rounds to achieve their goal to enter into the finish zone…sounds easy, as you just hope to get the win light.

boardgame.name: Eddie Arcaro Bluegrass Handicap Horse Race Game
boardgame.description:
An early 60's horse race game endorsed by legendary jockey Eddie Arcaro released by Transogram 1962. Released between Eddie Arcaro Sweepstakes (Lourol Enterprises) 1954 and Eddie Arcaro Riders Up (Riders Up Inc.) 1969. The game features beautiful mid century illustrated box art and colourful board graphics.

A 3 dice horse race game with an elementary betting component. The inside lanes are shorter and lane changing adds a measure of strategy and skill to the racing. The goal can be simply to have your horse win the race or add betting to win the most amount of money.
—user summary

boardgame.name: The All-Fair Baseball Game
boardgame.description:
This is a partly mechanical, and rather complex, baseball game for two players, boasting a metal playfield inside a wooden frame.

A "hidden" trigger allows the pitcher to fire the ball, while the batter has a spring-loaded bat attached to the frame which can swat at the ball. Indented cups in the board at the various bases and home plate, as well as the outfield, allow the ball to come to rest and the play to be scored.

The game also includes a set of lead baseball player figures which can be moved around to represent the progress of taking bases, and so on.

boardgame.name: Game Turkeys
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Game Turkeys, you’re an online game team churning through dev cycles in an attempt to adhere to an ambitious release schedule, but a myriad number of issues continue to conspire against your carefully planned milestone calendar. You’ll have to band together to navigate through the obstacles that stand in your way to avoid your game being panned—or worse, ignored.

boardgame.name: Record of Lodoss War: The Original Replays from Comptiq Magazine
boardgame.description:
All eight installments for the first time ever in English

Publisher's blurb:

In 1986, Hitoshi Yasuda was approached by the editors of Comptiq magazine to write a series of articles about the origins of RPG games and specifically “D&D,” to coincide with the one-year anniversary of the Japanese release of Dungeons & Dragons.

Yasuda settled on the “Replay” format, thinking it the most illustrative of actual game play, and contacted Ryo Mizuno, a fellow member of gaming Group SNE to serve as Dungeon Master. Mizuno agreed and created an original campaign for Yasuda and five other players from Group SNE to serve as a showcase for the game.

The setting was an accursed island full of monsters, magic and adventure. The island was called “Lodoss” and thus was born “Record of Lodoss War.”

This book is an English translation of those original Record of Lodoss War replays as they appeared in Comptiq magazine from September 1986 to April 1987. The serialization has never been available in English before, and in fact, after the initial magazine run in Japan, it was never reprinted due to copyright issues. So what you have in your hands is a very rare thing indeed.

The popularity of “Record of Lodoss War” led to two additional serializations in Comptiq (Part II from June of 1987 to July of 1988 and Part III from September 1987 to September 1988), a series of compilations and books by Mizuno, Yasuda and Group SNE, two RPG systems (Record of Lodoss War ロードス島戦記ハンドブック and Sword World RPG (1st Edition)), as well as several manga and anime series. Its impact on the Japanese fantasy genre has been transformative.

boardgame.name: The Capital Cities Air Derby
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the interest in the flight of Charles Lindbergh, this is a race game to be the first aviator making a non-stop flight from New York to San Francisco.

The game includes a long bi-fold board of a map of the United States, with the various capital cities highlighted. Parallel game tracks in four bright colors (green, orange, yellow, red) cut through the center of the map, with little "detours" through various cities.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Metal Head メタルヘッド
MetalHead メタルヘッド
boardgame.description:
Frontier 2150
MetalHead
The Role Playing Game of the Frontier
メタルヘッド

User summary:

MetalHead (sometimes Metal Head) is a Japanese-language cyberpunk/mecha roleplaying game. It includes elements of post-apocalyptic themes and features a virtual reality realm populated by science fantasy monsters.

Characters in the game have nine randomly-generated Attributes (Strength, Reflex, Dexterity, Intelligence, Education, Perception, Sympathy, Will, and Luck) with values running from 3 to 18. Characters also select a class which yields access to percentile-rated Skills. Action resolution typically is performed with a modified 2d6 roll against a target number.

Box Set includes:

Player's Manual
Master's Manual
Scenario
Reference booklet
Character sheets
Advertising materials
d210 & 2d6

boardgame.name: Duel Arena
boardgame.description:
Duel Arena is a strategic resource management game in a medieval fantasy setting. Each player takes control of a Hero with unique abilities and must travel around the Arena collecting weapons and armour to become stronger. You must carefully manage the use of your items, as well as your Gold and Health. Only by correctly leveraging these resources will you be able to outmaneuver your opponents and claim victory.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hi-Way Henry
boardgame.description:
This is a race game based on cartoonist Oscar Hitt's 1926 comic strip of the same name. Players control tourists going for a cross-country trip in their busted-out old jalopy. Much of the appeal comes from Witt's sprightly graphics.

Movement is controlled by dice (cubes), but the brightly colored board includes a built-in tire spinner that can cause a sudden "blow-out."

—user summary

boardgame.name: Party Panda Pirates
boardgame.description:
Prepare yer crew of eye-masked pirates and make the ocean yarrs, and yarrs alone. Face different challenges as you and your crew travel the Avian Archipielago. Warm up yer paws for this dexterity-based family party game.

Slide your miniatures from the giant turtle-boat at the center of the board to land on the islands of Creature Kingdoms. Islands trigger a dexterity-based minigame. The players in the best places get more victory points.

Depending on all players' position, you might team up with other players, play 1-vs-many or free-for-all mini games. Be careful, as other Pandas will be trying to steal your Victory Points, but at the end of the game, bonus Victory Points are awarded to players who complete objectives.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: M.O.R.P.H.O.
boardgame.description:
Suffering the long-term suppression of allying aliens, the moribund underground rebellion, Morpho, is planning the last operation to overthrow the Empire. “The Empire is making every attempt to vacillate our minds. O’ mighty and honorable braveries! The world shall rebirth!”

M.O.R.P.H.O. is a quick and portable social deduction game. In a game for 3-6 players, you will control two identities to attain their winning condition. You could investigate the identities of other players to figure out the situation, hit the right timing to take action, or even change your character to explore a new winning condition.

Apart from the basic identities, you may also add the special ids-- Outsiders and Aliens to the game. Their abilities and goals can definitely provide diversity and fascinating experiences!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: DOUC in Danger
boardgame.description:
Get ready for an adventurous journey! You will go into the jungle and meet a species of monkeys fighting for survival. Help save the red-shanked DOUCs from extinction. Feel firsthand how hard it is for them to survive.
Take turns playing different roles in this extraordinary trick-taking game for the whole family. As a poacher you put DOUCs in danger, as a ranger you have to save them. As a tourist, you decide for yourself who you support. But beware, everyone pursues his own interests to win the game...

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Skyrise: Wooden Token Pack
boardgame.description:
This upgrade includes 60 custom colored wooden tokens, with screen printed imagery on both sides.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Würfelhelden
boardgame.description:
Players slip into the role of a dice hero and take hold of the villains who are up to mischief in the kingdom. With their dices, players secure the rewards or find valuable treasures. With courage and the favor of the dice, they will succeed in claiming glory and honor in the name of Therion.
A dice game for big heroes and little companions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Every Inch of Soil: The Chinese Civil War, 1945-1949
boardgame.description:
In August 1945, Japan made an unconditional surrender to the Allied Powers in World War II. At the end of the weary eight-year-long full-scale anti-fascist war, the Chinese Nationalist Party (KMT) and the Communist Party of China (CPC), temporarily united to resist invasion by militaristic Japan, were once again faced with the crisis of breaking up. An outright war that would soon engulf the whole country was about to come.

This strategic-level wargame applies our innovative game system specially designed for the Chinese Civil War. You will play as the Chinese Nationalist Party or the Chinese Communist Party through the civil war between 1945 and 1949. With a unique attack-and-reaction system and area control system, you can experience different tactics such as mobile warfare and guerrilla warfare in the Chinese Civil War, deploying resources across the whole country. With a political simulation and event system, you can also experience the political gambles of both sides in the civil war.

This is a war that will determine the fate of China's future. Should you concentrate your superior forces to destroy the enemy in one move, or reserve your strength by mobile operations? Should you strive to lead your side to a total victory in the war or conduct negotiations to gain an advantage in the coalition government? The choice is up to you.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Alarm
boardgame.description:
Alarm! At emergency dispatch, police officers, fire constables and ambulance drivers are making ready in a haste to dispatch and help anyone in need.

But there are several crisis at once, so the different crew has to work out together which order the emergencies are resolved.

Alarm is a cooperative game, where players win or lose as a team. They will win if they succeed to solve all emergencies, and will lose if they don't manage before the deck runs out for a second time, or if the alarm is triggered in all emergencies at once.

—description from the box

boardgame.name: YIGO
boardgame.description: YIGO is fast paced word building card game. It is mixture between UNO and scrabble with 7 different action cards that help you build the words. First player to lose all cards win the game.

boardgame.name: Paper Tales: L'Intégrale
boardgame.description:
This big box edition contains the base game, its first expansion as well as a brand new one.
The second expansion is made up of three new buildings, new units and a new set of cards: the Legendary Artefacts (not affected by aging, very powerful but very expensive).

Experience two fantastical centuries of expansions and combat in Paper Tales. Remodel your assorted assembly of characters, units, and buildings in each period based on your developments and the age of your heroes. Write a new legend of the rightful ruler who brought unity to the rival kingdoms.

In more detail, Paper Tales is a simultaneous drafting card game. Each turn, players draft five units that they then recruit into their kingdom — assuming that they can pay. These choices determine the players ability to shine in battle, generate great income, construct dominant buildings, and earn legend points. There are only four hiring positions available during the four rounds of the play, but your units grow older with each turn until time takes them away.

Build a comprehensive strategy and adapt the shape of your realm according to opportunities and restrictions and you will make history!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Paper Tales: Ce qui forge les légendes

boardgame.name: Sentenced to Death
boardgame.description:
A card game where you form inappropriate sentences about your fellow players.
Each player starts with several words chosen at random on cards. Player 1 says their name (or name of someone all players know) and then Player 2 plays a card to get the sentence going followed by Player 3 etc (eg Simon likes to play...).
The object of the game is to keep the sentence going whilst still making sense.
The winner is the first player to get rid of all their cards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The LOOP: Die Pelzbrigade
The LOOP: Brigade à poils
boardgame.description:
Paws in the air! The legendary Fur Brigade is back together again. Play as Catruman the Black, king of the catgicians and Arsène Lupus the were-gentlewolf to go scratch at Dr Foo’s door. And don’t forget the new Artifacts from R&D, with their Voidhole Dimensions and their Charcoal 14 teleporters.

Each of these two brand new characters comes with their own fresh playstyle.
Catruman's forbidden magical knowledge will let you play with 4 cards in hand instead of 3. How powerful can he grow through building his deck?
Arsène Lupus is the master of Charcoal 14, a new resource that allows agents to teleport directly to an Era containing a piece of it.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The LOOP

boardgame.name: Battle of Pensacola
boardgame.description: The Battle of Pensacola game is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the Spanish and French attack on British held Pensacola in 1781 during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Spanish and French forces and the other player commands the British forces.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Roll 'n' GOL: Siga Siga
boardgame.description:
Roll 'n' GOL: Siga Siga expansion incorporates 20 new teams and new actions: “Penalty with yellow”, “VAR”, “Investigate” and “Replay”. In addition, the match for third place that is played before the grand final.

Contains:

new block of sheets
20 new teams
1 VAR coin
rulebook
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Roll 'n' GOL

boardgame.name: Kombi-Rechenspiel
boardgame.description:
Five matematical symbols (+ - : x =) and one number card are placed on the table. Each player is dealt 6 number cards. The goal of the game is to get rid of ones cards by using them to form equations by combining them with the card on the table to equal the number card on the table.

If a player can't form an equation, he draws up to 3 cards from the deck. If he still isn't able to form an equation, the next player takes his turn.

The first player to get rid of his cards wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Primal Forest (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

Wilderness Dressing: Primal Forest presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Tower Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The lonely tower you keep passing by as you are adventuring might hold more secrets than you think (or it might just be the house of an eccentric magician, really). Get the exploration started with our Tower Generator!

This product contains:

2 tables for the general characteristics of the tower (number of levels, levels connection),
6 tables for the description of the tower: outside (state, material, shape, details), inside and special equipment,
5 tables focused on each type of level (ground, aboveground, top, underground, bottom),
1 explanatory diagram.

boardgame.name: Way of the Dragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A town under attack! A lord desperate to protect his people and family from mysterious mountain monks...

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 3
Experience from Completion: ~10,035 XP
General Theme: Honor, Duty, Family
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x2 session - x6 hours

boardgame.name: Spirit Island: Nature Incarnate
boardgame.description:
"There are things yet unseen among the deepest roots of the land, and they now rise to meet the coming white sails."

The next expansion of the award-winning settler-destruction board game, containing new spirits, new aspects, new threats and new powers!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Spirit Island

boardgame.name: Bone of Contention
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arriving at Igenfrost Outpost in search of adventure, the party is drawn into a dark and dangerous mystery through a chance encounter with a frost troll in this classic medieval fantasy adventure for 3-5 Seasoned heroes.

boardgame.name: Return to Dark Tower: Covenant
boardgame.description:
New heroes to play, new treasures to uncover, new corruptions to get in your way and more!

More content to use in your quest to take down the Dark Tower!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Return to Dark Tower

boardgame.name: Todo Sobre Mí
boardgame.description:
Game to socialize and generate empathy with all the participants. Ideal for teenagers and adults who want to have fun trying to know what the rest of the participants think. The more you know the players, the more chances of winning, and if not, they will have to risk their answers, making the game even more fun.

Ideal for teenagers and adults who want to have fun trying to know what the rest of the participants think.

After reading the question aloud, the rest of the players choose the answer they think is correct, then the answers are read and scored. The winner is the one who guesses the most, showing more empathy with others.

boardgame.name: Koi Garden: Solo & Cooperative Expansion
boardgame.description: A deck that allows you to play Koi Garden solo and cooperative.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Koi Garden

boardgame.name: Yoguis y Yoguinis
boardgame.description:
A game to learn Yoga while playing. A beautiful invitation to practice yoga and feel all its benefits.

It consists of a board tour where as the players advance they can draw different cards. Each of them has different Yoga postures and breaths to learn and practice. Several game options are proposed, all with the aim of learning and practicing this beautiful discipline that is yoga.

The first to reach the end of the board gains access to the medallion that turns them into a guide to help the others perform the postures until they reach the end of the board.

boardgame.name: Ramia: Rain and Faith
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

To you who holds this tome in your hand,

Our world is very young, barely a millennia old, yet already we have been through so so much. Cataclysmic floods, continents-spanning wars, inventors delving deeper than any of them should. It is impressive, you do not think too closely about it. My assignment, as deemed by the nobility of Melkere my home kingdom of nearly forty eight years was to collect in short summaries of the various nations of our world. if

The Four Great Regencies as they are named today are detailed within, along with a synopsis of our Ramian calendar, the spiritborn phenomena, and will admit - a far greater collection of history on Melkere. Being that we are one of the most populous nations in the Scalesoul Kingdoms, I believed that it would be beneficial to spend more time discussing my homeland, as this is also the place that I know best.

I hope that this collection finds you well, but understand that what I have captured within is only a small piece of what our world has to offer for travelers who come here, but also that times are changing. Ramia is wracked with religious and political conflict. Things are...in the moment...not as they once were.

Best of luck to you.

Azamoht Fenzor

Formed by a loving mother and torn apart by numerous years of conflict and zealotry, Ramia today is a world of challenging circumstances. In one camp is the new extremist wing of the Church of Ramia, while in the other is the burgeoning military-industrial Kekorak Imperium. Caught in the middle are the smaller independent nations; the Scalesoul Kingdoms, Alstaros Principalities, and Shylmyn Duchies all trying to keep their head above water as the two beasts rear their heads to attack. Built upon the ruins of former troll empires, draconic houses, and flooded kingdoms, those who populate the world of Ramia today would do well to remember the past conflicts that rocked her.

Campaign Across Time

Containing four subclasses and two character templates, Ramia: Rain and Faith offers players and Alders our largest microsetting yet! This microsetting presents a timeline from Ramia's creation, allowing Alders to plan their Ramian campaign across the broad span of Ramia's history, from the Years of Rain to the Yeti Wars - there is everything. a spot for

Different from our other microsettings, Ramia is written to provide a detailed starting zone in the world with the Scalesoul Kingdoms, while small chapters on each of the other Great Regencies and the additional lands scattered across the map. This allows players and Alders to build a good sense of the world and develop their group before exploring out into the wilds of Ramia. Or, you might make the choice to just dive right into Principalities, Duchies, or Imperium! the

boardgame.name: Comets & Cockpits: Geographica Adelphos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is Junker Space Fantasy?
So let’s break down these two separate genres as they are quite different -- beginning with space fantasy. The genre of space fantasy is usually categorized by several items: the inclusion of some sort of “mythic quest,” a young pupil and aged master, a kind of knightly order or analog, and a dark force or power which the pupil and master must fight against. The most clear example of this is George Lucas’ Star Wars or something like the Buck Rogers and Flash Gordon serials of the 1930s. Whether it is in the far future or far past, there is this fantastical quality to the science fiction story that grants it that moniker of space fantasy. To coin a phrase, “magic space wizards” is a perfect description of what space fantasy is at its core.

Now the junker element. Films like Mad Max or Waterworld would count as junker films as they are post-apocalyptic or occurring during the apocalypse and place an emphasis on a junky, rusty, rough and tumble kind of aesthetic. Fury Road does perhaps the best job of exemplifying this genre, followed by video games like Borderlands or Destiny, both of which have those rough-around-the-edges kind of quality to them that lend well to the junker aesthetic.

So junker space fantasy… how the hell does that work?

Junker space fantasy plays on the visual inspiration of the junker theme but has the mythic and fantastical elements of the space fantasy. The plethora of worlds and the biotechnological nature of the planet of Adelphos are designed to feel like a hybrid of scientific engineering and magic or perhaps a kind of union of one overtaking the other. A young speeder pilot who built his suit from scrap metal under the tutelage of an old battlesmith who is fighting against the expansion of a shadowy empire is an example of a union between those two genres.

Whether it is forming a guild to clown around the stars while exploring alien ruins; blasting huge monsters aside with a rune-powered gun; working in the hold of an old treasure galleon on your scrappy speeder; or performing powerful cosmagic in the depths of a black hole being opened in the middle of the county capital surrounded by xeno-necromancers -- Comets & Cockpits invites you to strap on your armor, grab your saddle and coneslinger, gather some other junkers and make the deep dive into wild and zany space fantasy that we present for your 5e table.

From the Journal of Ironbashk, Space Goblin Warlock and Junker Extraordinaire
Hello there, junkers! Welcome to Adelphos, and in turn welcome to Haven! Arlo Runewright is the usual greeting committee, but he got tangled up taking care of some stuff in the Map Room with Tessin and Edmora, so he put me in charge! Dangerous choice! Anyhow, it is my job to welcome ya ta our little nook in the universe. Well, technically it ain’t little, since Adelphos is 39 billion square kilometers -- but that is beside the point! I am here to tell ya argon from apples, so here is the dealio: there are three important rules to surviving in Haven.

First rule -- ya are gonna see a lotta strange shit around, go figure! Ya are on our ancestral homeworld, something we ain’t seen in a couple millennia, SURPRISE! So the more you learn to go with the flow, the lot better this whole “acclimating” process is gonna go.

Second rule -- do not drink the blue water. Don’t give me the crock of “Oh, Ironbashk, water is blue!” No it ain’t dumbass, water is clear! I mean do not drink for the areas where you see a lurid blue spill of some kind of gunk. Means dire tardigrades have been there and gotten their rune goo everywhere.

Third rule -- throw everything ya know out the window. Ya would think with rule number one that would be self explanatory. WRONG! Shit don’t work here like it does back on yar normie homeworld, punks. Magic, monsters, money -- all different in Haven.

And the fourth rule -- fruk ya, I am adding a fourth one -- trust yar gut. Sure, there are times that ya can use yar head and logic yart way outta some shit ya might have landed in. But here in Haven and on Adelphos, ain’t got time for that shit. Eat or be eaten, shot or be shot, live or unlive.

We are visitors here on this rock - our ancestors might have lived here thousands of years ago, but it outgrew us while we was gone. Our fancy tech and magicks and speeders and whatnot ain’t jack against a planet that SURVIVED A TITAN EXPLODING HERSELF. So keep that in mind when ya are out and about. Oh, and here is this, some sorta guidebook that Arlo threw together on the planet and Haven. I added my own notes, of course.

Good luck! Ya gonna need it!

boardgame.name: Twilight & Rust
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Twilight & Rust, an epic adventure in the Stockade! This adventure is designed for four or five 5th-level characters. The party has been employed by a local museum to retrieve a pair of gloves of metalworking from a mysterious and dangerous creature’s lair hidden deep within the Stockade. No one knows what the creature is, and though many have tried to retrieve the gloves, none have been successful. Many do not return, and the few who do arrive stuttering about “flying dust.” The party arrives at The Twilight Lantern, where they are to meet their guide, Koldon Bancroft.

Brought to you by the amazing Shannon Roby, this amazing little one-shot takes your players into the Stockade, an uncharted wasteland of rubble, rust, and wreckage. Giving a Weird West feel for your group, perhaps the gang is looking for something new and are ready to tackle the frontier beyond…? We shall see! Isabela Duffles’ fantastic art pulls you into the gritty - but hopeful - town of Solar Springs where our adventure begins…

boardgame.name: Operation Sprechenhaltestelle
boardgame.description: Introductory mission for Top Secret. From the Administrator booklet: "This package forms the special instructional module for play of Top Secret, and as such, is specifically designed for beginning players and Administrators. Due to its special design, it has numerous applications and serves a multiplicity of purposes."

boardgame.name: Oceans: 5-6 Player Expansion
boardgame.description:
Want more people to play in the Oceans with you? This expansion allows up to 6 to play.

Includes:
40 fish tokens
10 species boards
2 bonus tokens
2 player screens

Please Note:
If you have the Limited Edition of Oceans, you already have this.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Oceans

boardgame.name: GiantLands Box Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

GiantLands is a science fantasy world with a traditional table-top roleplaying game at its center that you can play at home, at official events, and soon in a mixed-reality game park. It combines tabletop roleplaying, cosplay, and cutting edge technology to create new kinds of immersive experiences that blur the line between fantasy and reality.

boardgame.name: Aesyr: Trollborn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A World Regrowing...
To they who have found this tome,

What you hold within your hands is a long and arduous work to collect the history and legends of our long imprisoned world into a volume that is processable enough for those young individuals who might start to grow within our borders.

The trolls of the Xukzun Imperium held Aesyr in chains for millennia until our gods were able to rise up and break us free of bondage. However, in recent decades, chaos has started to return to our lands as the gods choose to follow their own desires and paths rather than heed the wishes and needs of the people they once helped to rescue.

Exploring our thirteen counties, the methods of magic used by our people, our coinage, and the phenomena of trollblooded children growing amongst our populace - this book will be your guide, along with my own small notes, to the rebirthed world of Aesyr.

Zachariah Dalemorn, Former Ranger-General of the Olryn Order

The World of Aesyr
In a land shrouded by fog and mysticism, the Xukzun Imperium reigned supreme for millenia, believed to have gotten their powers from the Titans of Creation themselves. However, the mortal races - all created by the Xukzun trolls - came to chafe under this rule and took up arms against their makers. Mortals would have failed had it not been for the gods, individuals who used troll magicks to ascend to incredible and sometimes horrible power. While some worried that the gods might fill the power vacuum left by the trolls, this fear faded as the gods and mortals worked together to push the trolls back over the southern and northern mountains into the great cloud forests that fill the landscape beyond their impressive peaks.

Today the gods walk amongst the people of Aesyr, and wherever they wander demigods are born called trollblooded. These trollblooded will sometimes erect temples to their godly parents, or will simply try to live without the cloud of divinity over their heads. Mortals themselves can ascend to godhood, either through defeating a god - which has only happened on three occasions - or finding lost troll laboratories and undergoing ascension rituals...should they survive.

boardgame.name: Zed & Two Noughts
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Terror descends upon a quiet town, kidnapping citizens and thrusting them into a hellish nightmare. Trapped aboard a vessel crewed by prophecy-driven shapeshifters, unfortunate souls must band together—or perish. Fight brutal monsters, avoid devastating traps, and test your wits against an inscrutable enemy in …

ZED & TWO NOUGHTS

boardgame.name: Espamena: Isles of Swords
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greetings new arrival!

Creedence MacAbby is the name, writing is the game. What you hold in your hands is a booklet to tell you all about our amazing archipelago that you have come to! I have made an effort to include my own little notes as I think it will just help to add some greater context throughout the readings and the like.

The most important thing that you must truly understand about Espamena is that we are a nation of nature and economics, in that order. While we love our trade, should anything endanger the fragile balance of mortals and the motherland, we must about-face and rectify it before anything should harm her.

We only have the one life we are given, and thank the waemren that they are here to help guide us. So, read on, new Espamenite, and learn of your new home!

- Creedence MacAbby

The World
This archipelago has long been missing from maps and star charts across the known world, hiding behind storms and reefs that were unpassable by ships. But with the help of waemren—individuals who could speak with the clouds, the sea, and the rain—the untouched islands joined the world stage, heavy and full of wilderness and beasts. People flocked to see the islands. When new eyes gazed upon the beauty of the place where life grew undisturbed and shielded by nature, they shed tears. Since then, the isles have grown in population. With the guidance of the waemren, all who dwell here strive to keep the balance of nature and civilization in harmony. Today, the nine houses rule the archipelago—now the nation of Espamena—and work towards a better future, while also waging their own secret political and trade wars behind the scenes. Beyond these petty squabbles though, life amongst the isles is full of color, art, music, and joy. All with their own unique cultures, songs, and languages, the Isles of Swords is a place of romance, craftsmanship, and conservation.

boardgame.name: Súper Viaje de Emociones
boardgame.description: Súper Viaje de Emociones is a game to talk about what happens to us. It contains a board, where the route is a trip that is made with all the participants and the Bigotes Cat as a companion. Upon landing in different boxes, the players raise a card that invites them to express their emotions in different ways. The first to arrive becomes the emotional guide of the game!

boardgame.name: Thrown Under the Bus: The Game of Office Politics
boardgame.description:
Thrown Under the Bus, the hilarious Game of Office Politics, TUtB is packed with cringeworthy buzzwords and all-too-familiar office tropes that will keep players entertained while they steal credit for coworkers’ hard work in an attempt to advance up the corporate ladder. But be careful. Fellow associates are attempting to do the same thing, and once you play a dirty trick on them, they now have access to this new trick. Anyone who has worked in an office environment knows there is no more brutal kill-or-be-killed workplace than the modern office setting.

Thrown Under the Bus (TUtB) is designed so that non-gamers could easily learn and enjoy but still has the complexities and advanced tactics that will keep seasoned gamers engaged. TUtB hits that delicate balance while creating a fun thematic experience. An average game takes between 30 and 90 minutes depending on group size of 2-6 players and their experience level. The Ages 16+ is more of a theme suggestion, the mechanics and rules can easily be understood by younger players but we felt why get them jaded about work before they enter the workforce. Let them discover that joy the same way we did…

Don’t let the cut throat theme fool you, Thrown Under the Bus is fun and cathartic release at the end of a long week of dealing with your coworkers quirks and protecting your station at work.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rix Olympia Regatta Spiel '72
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to pass space 55 wins the game.

Sail ships for this game were included in 500g packages of Rix bread.

boardgame.name: A Concise Treatise on the Cosmology of Ghaistala
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the Records of G.E.A.R.
This tome is a collection of the notes and wisdom of nearly fifty years research into the cosmology of our world as we know it. While the knowledge we are uncovering from within the Beacon grows by the day as new levels and doors unlock, there is still so much we do not know.

The illustrations within this book are made by the amazing Zanthan Auwnamas of the Collegium Beacarus, combinations of various different descriptions of the Titans from media across the levels of the Beacon.

Not only does this book shed light on our cosmology, but also on our calendar, celestial markers, and holidays that we celebrate.

Disclaimer: we at G.E.A.R. do not condone or support experimental portal building, theoretical leyphysics, or the attempt to launch ones self into the Ring of Virtue via paragite cannon. This book is meant to be a guide to understand our cosmos, not prompt increased exploration by unsanctioned and unlicensed adventurers. Any loss of life or limb while attempting planar travel within the Ghais-Sphere is not the fault of G.E.A.R.

boardgame.name: Skull Canyon: Ski Fest – Gear Promos
boardgame.description:
This promo pack for Skull Canyon: Ski Fest adds three new Gear cards: Hot Chocolate, Pandasaurus Earmuffs, and Fanny Pack. The new cards can simply be shuffled into the Gear card deck.

- Hot Chocolate: On your last turn of the Skiing phase, if you end your turn at the bottom of the slope, earn +2 VP.

- Pandasaurus Earmuffs: Whenever you occupy the same waypoint or lodge as 1 or more other players, gain +1 fame.

- Fanny Pack: Earn +1 VP each time you steal a green run.

A copy of Skull Canyon: Ski Fest is required to play with these promo cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Skull Canyon: Ski Fest

boardgame.name: The Lunar Knight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You were once lost, wandering the woods, desert, or mountains of Ghaistala without a path or guide—only the mother moon was there to help you past kaiju and supervillians. In time, you came to see her for who she truly was: a well source of power, and a light for all to see and love – perhaps even a Titan in of herself. That is when you were found by the Lunar Knights—striking warriors of silver, blue, white, and violet who took you in and trained you, transforming your love for the mother moon into something truly powerful.

The Lunar Knight is a fighter subclass built definitely for more supernatural or horror-themed adventures, BUT, there are definitely unique ways you could weave it into your campaign on Ghaistala or in Beacon! Perhaps your character crashes through a portal and slams into the Portal Plaza, with no memory other than your charter tattoo. Or, maybe you feel a powerful connection to one of Ghaistala's moons, or even one of the great Kaiju who wanders the planet.

Pick from one of five charters: New Moon, Crescent Moon, Half Moon, Gibbous Moon, and Full Moon - all with unique and different powers based on the phase of the moon! With Raul Volpato's amazing art, this first supplement for Supers & Sorcery pops and flares with radiant possibility!

boardgame.name: Destination Moon Palace
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Destination Moon Palace is a 5e compatible adventure for four to six adventurers of level 7. It continues the story started in Moon Elves' Masquerade by examining what the deposed Moon Prince, Claviceps Purpurea did after his downfall. The adventure can be run in 3 - 4 hours and takes place in both the Moon and Hell. While on the moon, the PCs' jump distance is tripled and they take no damage from falling.

The ocean has been in chaos for months, rising and falling unpredictably, causing countless nautical disasters and wreaking havoc on coastal settlements. The entire planet is feeling the effects. Wizards have determined the straightforward, but baffling, cause: the moon, regulator of the tides, is shrinking in mass. They have organized to send the PCs to the moon, in hopes of ascertaining, and hopefully solving, the problem. The PCs gather, supplied for their perilous journey with moon-suits and a Scroll of Teleport to return home. The wizards intone their spell, and the teleportation circle activates. There is a whoosh and a pop, and the PCs appear on the moon.

boardgame.name: The Trouble with Dreams
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Queen Aisling was among the kindest, wisest, and strongest of rulers - before she broke a statue of the Dreaming King. Now cursed with nightmares, she hasn’t slept for more than a half-hour for weeks. Irrational judgments, belligerent confusion, crumbling sanity: the Queen’s insomnia threatens total ruin for us all.

Yet a Wise Queen has wise advisors. The Duchesses have hired a small team of hardened mercenaries, and a Somnomancer to send them into the Realms of Slumber. Their mission is to lift the Dreaming King’s curse, by any means necessary. The payment is substantial: 700gp each.

The Trouble with Dreams is a dream-delve for four sixth-level characters. Be warned: those who die while bodily within the Realms of Slumber never fully awaken again. They experience a half-life as permanent sleepwalkers. Also, taking a Long Rest in the Realms of Slumber will return you to the World of the Waking. Do not return before your work is done.

boardgame.name: Warlock Joe's Dungeon for Babies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warlock Joe, aka Josiah Darksoul (not his real name), is an epic-level magic-user who has transcended such paltry things as life and death and space and time. Now, he amuses himself by building dungeons and luring adventurers and monsters into it for fun. Joe is concerned about the youths. He is worried, in these changing times, that the next generation of adventures will come of age without ever having set foot into a dungeon, much less one containing a dragon! He aims to ensure that grim future never comes to pass, by creating an introductory dungeon for 4 LVL 1 PCs.

boardgame.name: Puppets of Beeglemaus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Somewhere in the Microsphere of Zimbus Zane, the wizard Beeglemaus hides from Rhinoman justice! You have spotted the ruins of his famously ostentatious golden barge smoldering in the fens. Descend heroes, but be cautious; your foe is all the deadlier for being cornered!

boardgame.name: Pig-Faced Killers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Watch is bad here. Their abuse of their authority is so audacious, so grievous, so cruel, that the god of justice placed a curse upon their profession; any man joining their ranks would see himself turned into a pig-faced monster over the course of his first year on the job. Rather than repenting, reforming, or disbanding, the Watch has doubled down, wearing their porcine features with pride, declaring it the cross they bear for their noble service. They call themselves "Officers of the Peace", but to everyone else, they're just "the Pigs".

boardgame.name: Ali Baba und die 40 Räuber
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On the orange spaces the player may move an additional number of spaces forward, only on number 99 he has to move 9 spaces backwards. On the violet spaces the player may only move further when he rolls a 6. If a player gets on space 100 he has to go back to space 1.

The first player to reach space 97 or 105 wins the game.

The game was published on a sheet of paper.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves

boardgame.name: Im Zick Zack Kurs aufwärts
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces the player automatically moves forward or backwards. On some spaces the player may roll again.

The first to reach space 128 wins the game.

The game was published on a sheet of paper.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Operative's Dossier
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A New Mission for a New World

For five centuries the Ascension War has pitted the Enlightened against Reality Deviants. Bloodshed and horror from this conflict have nearly torn the world apart on a number of occasions. In the hopes of creating a safe environment and shepherding the Masses to Ascension, the Technocratic Union has used colonialism, conditioning, and violence to bring their vision of a unified Reality to fruition. At the dawn of the 21st Century it appeared as if victory was within the Union’s grasp, but Control failed to consider one major factor in the War for Reality: The Masses.

Now as anti-science sentiment, climate change, misguided nationalism, and plague threaten the very fabric of Reality, the Union must swallow its pride and seek new alliances. Failure to meet this challenge ends with the Technocratic Union in a dominant role over a broken, dead world. The Technocracy has come to understand that humanity’s destruction is imminent. The Union lacks the tools to save humankind on its own. Thus, new alliances must be formed.

The Operative’s Dossier includes:

Digital Web 3.0: New rules for accessing the Digital Web in the 21st Century, including the introduction of Augmented Reality.
Mission Statements: A collection of story hooks that can be dropped into an existing Chronicle or serve as the basis for an all new Technocracy story.
The Technomancer’s Toybox: A collection of Devices, Adjustments, and Procedures to aid the Agents of the Technocracy in saving Reality from imminent doom, as well as rules for building Constructs and incorporating Terranorming into your Mage 20th Anniversary Edition Chronicle.
Unlikely Allies: Guidelines for inter-faction play, incorporating mages of the Council of Nine, The Disparate Alliance, and the Unaligned in your Technocracy campaign.

boardgame.name: Nom Noms: carta promo Dragón
boardgame.description: An additional character card for Nom Noms, allowing an additional 7th player.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Nom Noms

boardgame.name: Exploradores de las Profundidades Sombrías. Compendio de Aventuras 1
boardgame.description:
The Adventure Compendium includes the first five campaigns published in English: Blood Moon, Temple of Madness, Ghost Stone, Incinerator and Menagerie. Five complete supplements that will provide you with endless hours of game.
It includes 5 resin coffers for the game.

El Compendio de aventuras incluye todas las primeras campañas publicadas en inglés: Luna de sangre, El templo de la locura, La piedra fantasma, El incinerador y Casa de Fieras. Cinco suplementos completos que os proporcionarán horas y horas de emoción. Incluye 5 cofres de resina para poder jugar
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Rangers of Shadow Deep
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Blood Moon
Rangers of Shadow Deep: Ghost Stone
Rangers of Shadow Deep: Temple of Madness

boardgame.name: Regatta
boardgame.description:
Each player gets 6 sailing boats. The players start on opposite sides of the game board and have to reach the opposite edge of the game board. The players take turns to roll 2 dice and move.
On the roll of a 5 and a 2 the player moves one boat from space 5 to space 2 in the next row and another boat from space 2 to space 5 in the next row. On the roll of a double the same boat may be moved two times. If a boat has passed the middle of the game board it moves two rows: for instance from space 5 to space 2 in the next row and from there to space 5 one row further. If a boat reaches a destination space the player gets a bonus move.

The first player to get all 6 of his boats to the opposite side wins the game.

The game was published on a sheet of paper.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Frogger and the Rumbling Ruins
boardgame.description:
After the popular Apple Arcade game 'Frogger in Toy Town,' an all-new Frogger game 'Frogger and the Rumbling Ruins' (Frogger and the Rumbling Ruins) leaps into action!

Make your way through puzzle-ridden ruins and unravel the mysteries of the Ancient Salientians.

- Guide Frogger through the ruins by manipulating the terrain!
- Simple and intuitive three-dimensional puzzles.
- More than 100 stages with all sorts of traps and enemies!
- And in the deepest parts of the ruins, will a ferocious boss battle await?
- A fun and friendly story with a group of unique friends.
- Add all treasures found in the ruins to your collection!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Bower
boardgame.description:
You have a mere 9 months to prepare! Your nest is drab and bare, sticks and leaves won't draw anyone's eye. Collect trinkets and tokens from the forest floor to increase the appeal of your nest. It doesn't have to be perfect, it just has to be better than that other guy's.

Bower is a competitive 2 player, pick-up and deliver game with engine building upgrades and push-your-luck scoring elements. Gameplay revolves around strategic pathfinding and turn optimisation. On your turn, your opponent will first populate the forest with berries and trinkets using the seed deck. You may then alter the paths through the forest by rotating the 7 central tiles, before moving your Bowerbird along its current path, collecting the trinkets you pass over. If you can return your bowerbird to the nest, you score points depending on the number of trinkets it returned with. You also earn a powerful crest to enhance your future turns. The player with the most points from their bower and personal goal cards is the winner.

Note: Great Bowerbirds (endemic to Australia) have a fascination with anything green or white. The Males will collect as many discarded toys, plastic scraps, stones, bones and shells as they can find to decorate their nest (Bower), in the hopes of scoring a partner during the November-January mating season. Young males will even work together on a “practice” nest, to ensure their skills are properly honed.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monstrous Menagerie
boardgame.description:
"The Monstrous Menagerie is a compilation of homebrew monsters developed as part of my 5-year long, level 1 to level 20 D&D campaign.

Face a bullywug potentate riding atop his dire toad mount! Or fight a megalodon aboard an animated ship! Pit your players against a nefarious coven of sea hags, each with a role to play within the coven.

Monsters come with encounter ideas to help spark your imagination, along with evocative descriptions and sidebars highlighting the monstrous NPCs that made their way into my game!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Holosseum TCG
boardgame.description:
Sci-Fi Trading Card Game about reality benders fighting in a galactic battle royal to save their home world from complete annihilation. reduce your opponents life to 0 before they can do the same to you.

Holosseum TCG is built around the simplicity of a card limiting mechanic not a mana system. This allows a much deeper complex and engaging gameplay. You will be pulling from a card pool over 200 distinct cards. Each game is as much a galactic turn-based tale you can share with friends, as it is a battle for your planet.

The Story
HOLOSSEUM TCG is a Sci-Fi/ cosmic horror trading card game set in an indeterminate time and a galaxy pretty close by.
As a Grid Runner, you'll represent your team in a galactic gladiator competition. The competition takes place in a planet sized arena, the Holosseum. Ran by the Dimmu, an ancient species of reality bending beings from a previous universe, the fate of the competition rests in your hands!
The Dimmu have chosen 5 Teams to fight for their lives and their fates in the Holosseum. Use the very essence of reality to cast cosmic spells and summon grotesque entities from mysterious realms; this is a competition you'll want to win.

boardgame.name: My First Bakery Board Game
boardgame.description:
Help the bakers get the bakery display’s ready for the day! It’s almost time for the bakeries to open and the bakers need to get all the tasty treats ready before the bakeries open for the day. Players take turns to find matching pairs of treats for their bakery before time runs out. Memorize where the matching treats show up and avoid turning over the clock that counts down to opening time.

In My First Bakery, kids can work together to find all the pairs of matching treats needed to get their bakeries ready while trying to avoid the clock that is counting down to opening time. For an extra challenge bakers can compete in a bakery showdown to be the first one to find all of their matching treats before the other bakers! If players can find all their matching pairs of treats before the clock reaches the last space and the bakeries must open, everyone wins!

Colorful and detailed images and settings make this story driven game a great way for kids to develop their strategic thinking, teamwork, and memory skills. Limited reading and image based play make this an easy game for kids ages 4+ to learn and play!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Baby Penguin Racing
boardgame.description:
Race to the bottom of the iceberg to be the first penguin to reach the pool party and win the last piece of cake! There’s a pool party happening at the bottom of the iceberg and some of the penguins are late! Players move their penguin down the iceberg by speeding ahead on ice slides and avoiding big ice cracks to be the first penguin to reach the pool party and win the last piece of cake.

In Baby Penguin Racing kids race down the different levels of the iceberg, while trying to avoid ice cracks that will send them backwards and jumping onto ice slides that will speed them ahead. Players move along the board by using their numbered cards to move ahead. Use the cards strategically to avoid obstacles, land on bonuses, and slow the other penguins down. The first penguin to reach the pool party wins!

Baby Penguin Racing has bright and colorful images and scenes that make this game a fun and creative way for kids to learn new skills like strategic thinking, communication, and basic counting. Limited reading and counting, and image-based play make this the ideal game for kids ages 4+ to play!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Pirates Gold!
boardgame.description:
Subtitled "A Treasure Hunt for Buried Loot," this game is - surprisingly - a variation on Parcheesi. Players follow a zig-zag path to get their four pirates to the Treasure Chest at the center of the board first.

This game is present in the 1928 "All-Fair" catalog, but clearly predates it by at least one year. It was no longer listed in the catalog by 1930.

boardgame.name: About Us: Boomer+ Edition
boardgame.description:
About Us, Boomer+ Edition is about Canada's Baby Boomers PLUS their peers a few years older. Through our research partner, we conducted an online survey of this demographic group and asked oodles of questions on a variety of topics, covering many aspects of their lives. Their answers? You'll have to play the game to find out!
Guess:

What % of the Boomer+ population has gone skinny dipping?
Which Boomer+ age group is most likely to have been hypnotized?
Which Boomer+ gender is more likely to have a tattoo?
There are 180 questions and answers in this tabletop game! Feeling confident?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Baby Duck Racing
boardgame.description:
Swim to the end of the bathtub to be the first ducky to plug the bathtub drain and save playtime! The bathtub plug has been pulled and the water is draining, but the bath toys want to keep playing. Players race the duckies across the bathtub to reach the plug and become the hero of playtime while avoiding popping bubbles and trying to speed ahead on slippery soap suds!

In Baby Duck Racing kids race across the bathtub, while trying to avoid obstacles like popping bubbles, using the slippery soap suds to speed ahead, and dropping obstacles to slow the other duckies down. Players move across the board by using their numbered cards to move ahead. Use the cards strategically to avoid obstacles and land on bonuses while staying ahead of the other duckies. The first ducky to reach the bathtub plug and save playtime wins!

Baby Duck Racing uses bright and playful images and scenery to make this game a fun and imaginative way for kids to develop skills like strategic thinking, communication, and basic counting through hands-on play. Limited reading and counting, and image based play make this the perfect board game introduction for kids ages 4+.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: About Us: Grown Up Girls Edition
boardgame.description:
About Us, Grown Up Girls Edition is an _oh! so-much-fun_ party games everyone can play at the same time, Created from amusing (and _amazing!_) data about the female species, it combines grown up girl guesswork with good-old fashioned retail therapy. What could be better for your next girls' get together?

Think about what grown up girls dream about or what type of movie role would like to play? Or what pick-up line works best? You may be in for a surprise!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Brothers Bond: Board Game
boardgame.description:
Based on the Eisner-nominated webtoon by Ryan Benjamin and Kevin Grevioux. Chris Dias (Naramata, Ultramodern5) designed this cooperative tabletop game which allows two to four players to assume the roles of the characters from Brothers Bond and journey across a mystical land, partaking in numerous adventures in hopes of saving the world. Each game resides within a larger connected campaign where heroes travel across the land, engage in high-pitched action, and progress a story towards an epic climax. Along the way, characters develop and improve between sessions, carrying over skills and choices to later games.

The story of Brothers Bond centers on Yoshi, the young, arrogant crown prince set to inherit an empire.

After falling into trouble with his father, the one man he fears, Yoshi runs from home. Picked up by two blind wandering samurai, Yoshi grows up to learn honor and strength. He then decides to return to his homeland to claim his birthright and save his people from a demon invasion.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Watch This Game!
boardgame.description:
Each player chooses a set of 6 colored dice & matching speed cup. The game is played in a series of rounds. There are no turns, all players roll their dice at the same time.

Draw the top 3 cards and place them face up in the middle of all the players. These are what cards players will try to win in the round. To begin, players count down to showtime with '3, 2, 1, showtime!'. There are no turns, all players roll their dice at the same time.

After each roll, players place any of their dice next to a card to 'book' it. This indicates which cards they are rolling for. Players continue booking dice until the combination is matched and someone wins the card.
Any player that had dice booked on that card may now take them back.

When all 3 cards are collected the round is over and players add up their scores. Draw the next three cards and place them face up to start the next round. Keep playing rounds until someone collects 1 million subscribers!

boardgame.name: Soulmates
boardgame.description:
How well do you really know your friends – can you find your soulmate?

To find out, you collect Friend-Chips with every other player. You do this by correctly assessing your fellow players based on creative scenarios. The two players with the most Friend-Chips at the end of the game become Soulmates.

In each round, use one of 125 short scenarios with four possible answers.

First you decide for yourself, then you guess your fellow players’ decision.

If you and your partner match, you will each receive a Friend-Chip.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Top Ten Quiz
boardgame.description:
On each card you will find a chart with ten correct answers. You are not allowed to look at the cards or shuffle them before you start the game! Try to gain as many points as possible with your team. You will achieve this by giving up to ten correct answers for each Top-Ten-Chart. Form two teams, and choose one player of each team as that team’s captain during each round. The captains special rule is that they are not allowed to give any answers on their own. Instead, they must estimate the number of correct answers given by their team. The team with the most points after seven rounds wins!

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Zero Leader: Miniatures
boardgame.description:
The Zero Leader Aircraft Miniatures set adds metal miniatures to your game! Each set includes 18 Aircraft miniatures:
- 2x Ki-43 Oscar
- 2x AM62 Zero
- 2x P-40
- 2x F4F
- 2x D3A Val
- 2x B5N Kate
- 1x G4M Betty
- 2x SBD Dauntless
- 2x TBF Avenger
- 1x B-25 Mitchell

Miniatures come unpainted

boardgame.name: Dominion: Hinterlands – Update Pack
boardgame.description:
Dominion: Hinterlands (Second Edition) contains nine new types of Kingdom cards, which will be released on their own as an update pack for those who own the first edition of this expansion.

New cards include: Berserker, Cauldron, Guard Dog, Nomads, Souk, Wheelwright

Part of the Dominion series.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dominion
Dominion (Second Edition)
Dominion (Second Edition) Big Box
Dominion: Big Box
Dominion: Big Box
Dominion: Einsteiger-Bigbox
Dominion: Intrigue
Dominion: Special Edition

boardgame.name: Let's Be Magical!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Let's Be Magical! is a Breathless game about magical girls balancing school life, relationships, and fighting against the forces of evil. Its primary influence is the Precure franchise, but can accommodate anything from Sailor Moon to Madoka Magica.

boardgame.name: Breathless System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Breathless games focus on condensed simplicity. The rules, the setting, the rolling tables, and the character sheet all fit on a half-fold brochure. This makes it easy for anyone to print your game at home, and get started with nothing more than a set of polyhedral dice and a few pens.

Characters are talented and proactive. But the path that lies in front of them is perilous. They will face difficult tasks, try to catch their breath, scavenge what they can find, and try to get through in one piece.

boardgame.name: Breathless: Shoot, Loot, Survive
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The city has been walled up from the outside. You are stuck with breathless Crawlers roaming as far as the eye can see. You are surrounded by strangers, and the only thing left to do is survive. You can’t give up now.

boardgame.name: NEKO BOSS
boardgame.description:
NEKO BOSS is a fun abstract cat game. Players need to move their cats around Neko(cat) Town to take control of the streets. When the cat stack grows those cats can travel further. Also, the top cat on the stack is the one that controls that stack of cats.

Basic rule for standard edition.

Board is consist of 24 intersections and paths.
At first to decide players number, 2 or 3 or 4.
Each player has same number of own pieces.

phase 1: placement
Decide players turn and every player places their piece on the board(intersections) alternately.

phase 2: making groups by piece moving
A piece can move one space but it must stack on other piece(s). It can't move to vacant space.
Player who keeps top piece of the group can move them. They must move as same number of stack pieces straightly on the path jumping other piece(s). They can't move to vacant space.
Players can't pass their turn if they have regal take. Passing the turn means finishing their playing.
When all players has no regal take, then the game is over. 4 or more pieces stack is score. The player who keep more 4 or more stacks than opponents wins the game. Score is same, then player who keeps highest stack wins the game. All are same, then player who keeps more stacks wins the game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Nazarene's Lot
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Nazarene’s Lot es un pueblo fantasma ligado en el pasado a la brujería. Está a punto de ser demolido para construir en su lugar un embalse, y los personajes jugadores son los encargados de hacer el estudio del terreno. Pero hay fuerzas oscuras que están despertando y pondrán difícil la destrucción de su antiguo hogar.
Una aventura que sirve de prefacio a Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath, nuestra campaña lovecraftiana dedicada a La Cabra Negra de los Bosques.

boardgame.name: Mel
boardgame.description:
Back in 1994, in a demonstration which took place in Belgium, the sentence “If the bee disappeared off the face of the Earth, man would only have four years left to live” was exclaimed.
In Mel, you’re the queen bee and your purpose is to collect nectar and produce honey with the help of your swarm. Will you get your swarm of bees to feed you and your larvae for the good of the ecosystem?

The goal of the game is to be the queen bee with more nectar or honey points at the end of the game.

When it’s your turn, you have two options:

-Place one of your bees on the central flower crown (or the beehive) of the game board and move it compulsorily. The movement has to be either vertical or horizontal and has to reach the furthest clear flower crown or beehive of the chosen direction; it’s forbidden to jump over another bee.

-Move one of the bees which is already present on the game board. The possible movements are the ones stated in the previous step.

In either case, when your turn is over, the central flower crown (or beehive) can never be occupied. Now, it’s the turn of the queen bee situated on your left.

The game can end because of two different situations:

- When there are no bees left to play. When a queen bee places her last bee, the game ends for her, but the rest must go on.

-To cause a Mel: when you place a bee in the center of the game board, and you can’t move it anymore.

In that case, you need to add up the obtained nectar (or honey) points and the player with the highest score is proclaimed the winner. In case of a tie, the player who has a bigger group wins. if the tie continues, the player who has the second bigger group wins, and so on and so forth.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Little Bakers
boardgame.description:
Simply collect the ingredient cards to match the recipe you're cooking, by taking turns to pick up new cards and discard unwanted ones.

The winning baker will have collected everything they need to create their chosen bake in their hand of 6 cards. Leaving everyone else with a muddle of ingredients.

Children learn skills like turn-taking, coordination, and memory. They Can also try the selection of simple recipes included!

—description from the publisher
